-ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; background-color: #dde7f1; padding-left: 24px; padding-right: 24px; padding-top: 16px; padding-bottom: 16px; line-height: 1.25;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/diversity-drives-innovation-carly-fiorina?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BDun2TjZ%2FRa2aPyplD63CGA%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=39KO7aLjNhhGY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_hero_banner-0-open_on_linkedin_cta&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_hero_banner-0-open_on_linkedin_cta-null-cmaw3x~ln23zjnb~x-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-ln23zjnb-x&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmVmYjA4ZWNlZDY0ODlmYWI4YjYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZjgzNGNlOGY5Y2I2N2IyZmUxNmRiNzdmMzQ3ZTc3NGFmZWIwMDBmNjFmZjVhZDZlNSwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" class="text-color-text no-underline" style="cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.9); text-decoration-line: none;"> See what others are saying about this topic:<span class="text-color-brand font-normal text-md leading-regular" style="font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400; line-height: 1.25; color: #0a66c2;"> Open on Linkedin</span> </a> </td> </tr> <tr data-test-id="newsletter-content-preview"> <td class="px-3 pt-2" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-left: 24px; padding-right: 24px; padding-top: 16px;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td class="overflow-hidden " style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; overflow: hidden;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/diversity-drives-innovation-carly-fiorina?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BDun2TjZ%2FRa2aPyplD63CGA%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=39KO7aLjNhhGY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-headline_&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-headline_-null-cmaw3x~ln23zjnb~x-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-ln23zjnb-x&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmVmYjA4ZWNlZDY0ODlmYWI4YjYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZjgzNGNlOGY5Y2I2N2IyZmUxNmRiNzdmMzQ3ZTc3NGFmZWIwMDBmNjFmZjVhZDZlNSwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" style="color: #0a66c2; cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%;"> <img class="block w-full" alt="Newsletter cover image" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E12AQExfpq14FMbEQ/article-cover_image-shrink_720_1280/0/1695838664491?e=2147483647&amp;v=beta&amp;t=JwiyC9YcBhQmqxFrsHe1LMZokEGWznB56FeqDozRelU" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; display: block; width: 100%;"> </a> </td> </tr> <tr> <td class="py-2" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-top: 16px; padding-bottom: 16px;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/diversity-drives-innovation-carly-fiorina?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BDun2TjZ%2FRa2aPyplD63CGA%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=39KO7aLjNhhGY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_-null-cmaw3x~ln23zjnb~x-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-ln23zjnb-x&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmVmYjA4ZWNlZDY0ODlmYWI4YjYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZjgzNGNlOGY5Y2I2N2IyZmUxNmRiNzdmMzQ3ZTc3NGFmZWIwMDBmNjFmZjVhZDZlNSwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" class="no-underline font-medium text-sm m-0 text-system-gray-90" style="cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; margin: 0px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 500; color: #282828; text-decoration-line: none;"> <h2 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500;"> Diversity Drives Innovation </h2> </a> </td> </tr> <tr data-test-id="newsletter-content-preview--content"> <td class="pt-0.5 series-article-body" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; padding-top: 4px;"> <p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">In this edition of my ongoing newsletter, I am delighted to delve deeper into our critical and enlightening dialogue on diversity and inclusion, with a special emphasis on unraveling the dynamics of diverse teams that exemplify high performance and innovation. Understanding and embracing the elements that foster an environment where varying perspectives and experiences converge to drive organizational success and elevate our collective potential is crucial.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">You probably have encountered some workplaces that are not diverse. You generally know what that looks like. There are too few people who are different. Everyone is around the same age, everyone does the same things after work and they shop at the same stores. In other words, they live lives at work and outside of work that are very similar.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">But there are other, more subtle signs that your workplace isn’t very diverse – even if it may look like it is based on the statistics. In those workplaces, people who are not white men sit around the edges of every meeting and do not participate.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">In those workplaces, people frequently don’t talk to each other in a natural way because they’re afraid. They don’t engage with people who are different from them because they are afraid of saying the wrong thing – of offending someone.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Some workplaces that struggle with diversity have diversity training, but the employees don’t learn how to work with someone different from them.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">What do you see if you pick your head up and look around you at a truly diverse, high-performing workplace?&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">When you look around a room, you see a cross-section of people. They look different, they sound different, they have different experiences and perspectives. And most importantly, people can show up as they see themselves.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Across the board, diverse cultures are high-performing cultures.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">There is real idea generation and real discussion, which means disagreements. People can respectfully disagree with one another because they bring different perspectives to the table.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">So, in a high-performing culture, there is not unanimous agreement all the time – but most decisions end up driven by consensus because people listen to lots of input and ideas, but share common goals and commonly perceived problems.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">On a high-performance team, people like showing up. They want to bring all of themselves to work.</p> </td> </tr> <tr> <td class="pt-2 no-underline" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-top: 16px; text-decoration-line: none;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" data-test-id="email-button" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td valign="middle" align="left" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; margin: 0px; padding-bottom: 8px;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/help/linkedin/answer/4788?lang=en&amp;lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BDun2TjZ%2FRa2aPyplD63CGA%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=39KO7aLjNhhGY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-SecurityHelp-0-footerglimmer&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-SecurityHelp-0-footerglimmer-null-cmaw3x~ln23zjnb~x-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-ln23zjnb-x&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmVmYjA4ZWNlZDY0ODlmYWI4YjYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZjgzNGNlOGY5Y2I2N2IyZmUxNmRiNzdmMzQ3ZTc3NGFmZWIwMDBmNjFmZjVhZDZlNSwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" style="color: #0a66c2; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; margin: 0px; padding-bottom: 8px;">You are receiving LinkedIn notification emails. Others can see that you are a subscriber.</td> </tr> <tr> <td class="pb-1 m-0" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; margin: 0px; padding-bottom: 8px;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/futureview-factor-blueprint-employee-retention-daniel-burrus?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3Bk9jJW%2FmlQx%2BNYTDm%2FAvsmQ%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=1QcSpF3aPuhqY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_-null-cmaw3x~ln1zvedm~c5-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-ln1zvedm-c5&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmVmYjc4YmNmZDc0NTlkYTY4NjYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZmViNGRiNmI4ZTI2ZWZiZjhhMjQ3YjNlMWJhODMyNzFjMjNiYmU1ODA2MDliNDQ0NCwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" class="no-underline font-medium text-sm m-0 text-system-gray-90" style="cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; margin: 0px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 500; color: #282828; text-decoration-line: none;"> <h2 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500;"> The Futureview® Factor: A Blueprint for Employee Retention </h2> </a> </td> </tr> <tr data-test-id="newsletter-content-preview--content"> <td class="pt-0.5 series-article-body" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; padding-top: 4px;"> <p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Attracting and retaining the best employees are two completely different concepts. Hiring the best is usually a streamlined process of seeking out the most qualified and skilled individuals and getting them to view your organization as a <em style="font-style: italic;">positive</em> workplace to be in.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">But <em style="font-style: italic;">after</em> hiring is complete, it is <em style="font-style: italic;">their</em> turn to interview <em style="font-style: italic;">you</em>, in a way. They finally get to see what is behind the front door at your organization. Hiring the best employee for the job is one thing, but <em style="font-style: italic;">retaining</em> the best employee for the job is a whole other arena in the business world.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Yes, each of these instances may be difficult, but it is arguable that #retention has become the <em style="font-style: italic;">bigger</em> of the challenges.</p><h3 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.17em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">The Great Resignation of 2020</h3><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">During the COVID-19 pandemic of 2020, we experienced what is now known as “the Great Resignation.”</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">On the surface, thousands upon thousands of employees left their jobs for various reasons. But one of the most pervading feelings behind many resigning from their roles was that those individuals took a defining moment in human history, a global pandemic, to search for something offering more personal fulfillment.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">#Recruiting, #training, and benefits can cost $1,500 per employee turnover — a hefty chunk of change if you consider how many employees were exiting their roles during 2020. </p><blockquote style="margin-top: 1.5em; margin-bottom: 1.5em; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; display: block; border-width: 0; border-left-width: 4px; border-style: solid; border-left-color: #424242; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-left: 1.5em; font-size: 1em; font-style: italic; line-height: 1.5; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Retaining employees has now become more crucial than ever to many companies across industries.</p></blockquote><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">A recent study found that the top tenured organizations include <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/hsbc/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">HSBC</a> Bank and <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/neutrogena/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Neutrogena</a>, with an average 10.2 years worker retention. Some of us cannot fathom top-notch employees staying around that long! So what is <em style="font-style: italic;">their</em> secret?</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">No one sets out as a #businessleader to <em style="font-style: italic;">replace</em> team members every year. </p><blockquote style="margin-top: 1.5em; margin-bottom: 1.5em; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; display: block; border-width: 0; border-left-width: 4px; border-style: solid; border-left-color: #424242; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-left: 1.5em; font-size: 1em; font-style: italic; line-height: 1.5; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">We all want to keep our best-performing workers, so it is crucial that business leaders understand there is more to employee retention than money.</p></blockquote><h3 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.17em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">Align Your Futureview®</h3><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">The question you are likely asking yourself is: <a href="https://www.burrus.com/2015/05/the-anticipatory-organization/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">If we are an Anticipatory Organization®</a>, <em style="font-style: italic;">how</em> will this ensure our top employees <em style="font-style: italic;">stay</em> on our payroll?</p><h3 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.17em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">Futureview.</h3><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://www.burrus.com/2021/05/futureview-a-strategy-that-outsmarts-complacency/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">The term “Futureview” is one I coined some 30 years ago</a> as a fundamental component of the Anticipatory Organization Model. If you are new to my blogs and new to the concept of an aligned Futureview, let me explain:</p><figure><img data-media-urn data-li-src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQFN7gODnYTD_Q/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1695832704488?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=OYcuPxLnFwabWnem7VBOCBi03cHBNuVkoe1XR175_8c" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQFN7gODnYTD_Q/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1695832704488?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=OYcuPxLnFwabWnem7VBOCBi03cHBNuVkoe1XR175_8c" width="480" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; margin-top: 1em; display: block; max-width: 100%;"><figcaption style="margin-top: 0.8em; text-align: center; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.5; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);"></figcaption></figure><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">#Futureview is a vivid mental picture each of us holds of our future existence, both personal and professional. It is not a goal or plan — it is the <em style="font-style: italic;">actual</em> image in your mind, good or bad, of what is to come.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Every individual at a business or organization has their own Futureview. Your Futureview is incredibly powerful, as it controls the decisions you choose to make and the actions you forego. We need to analyze what our Futureview actually is, as a <em style="font-style: italic;">positive</em> one can be leveraged as a powerful strategic tool that allows us to take control of the future.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">When employees have a positive Futureview about where your organization is heading and their place in it, they are more likely to choose to stay and contribute to the good of the organization and everyone in it. Conversely, when they have a negative Futureview and feel as though the company is headed in a bad direction, morale declines and they begin to hunt for other positions for their own security.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">It is your job as a C-suite executive, business leader, or manager to <em style="font-style: italic;">unite</em> the Futureview of your employees as part of your organization! This alignment to a positive Futureview is not an easy task and requires critical thinking, but it is very possible.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Below are some steps to how you can establish a <em style="font-style: italic;">positive</em> Futureview for your employees:&nbsp;</p><ol style="margin-top: 1em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 1.5em; display: block; padding: 0px;"><li style="margin-left: 1em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5; letter-spacing: -0.15%; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>Analyze Your <em style="font-style: italic;">Own</em> Futureview</strong></p></li></ol><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">A positive, united Futureview is pervasive. This mindset naturally spreads to those around us at your organization. Do you yourself have a positive attitude about the future or a pessimistic, negative one? Do you see the future as filled with opportunity and abundance? Or is what you see in front of you one of disruption and insurmountable challenges?</p><figure><img data-media-urn data-li-src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQE0JWSBpcRi3w/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1695832727820?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=baYGjc24reHXRh8IIuME_275XS2qxnSKMhPRy7XDeuo" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQE0JWSBpcRi3w/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1695832727820?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=baYGjc24reHXRh8IIuME_275XS2qxnSKMhPRy7XDeuo" width="480" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; margin-top: 1em; display: block; max-width: 100%;"><figcaption style="margin-top: 0.8em; text-align: center; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.5; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);"></figcaption></figure><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">You cannot retain quality employees by being a negative leader. So the first step in retaining employees is to first get your own priorities in order. Analyze your own Futureview and make sure it is a positive one. This is a vital steppingstone that allows you to open your workers’ eyes to the bright future you believe in.</p><ol style="margin-top: 1em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 1.5em; display: block; padding: 0px;"><li style="margin-left: 1em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5; letter-spacing: -0.15%; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>Give Employees Purpose</strong></p></li></ol><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Are compensation and benefits important? Absolutely! Everyone needs to pay the bills. But is that all you have to offer? Not by a long shot! Employees need more than just money to feel fulfilled and satisfied.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">It is human nature to seek validation, to want to feel heard and seen, and to want to be recognized for our achievements. In addition to competitive salaries, retaining employees means aligning them with a sense of <em style="font-style: italic;">purpose</em>, a reason to want to come to work, and giving honest feedback to let them know that their work has made a difference.</p><ol style="margin-top: 1em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 1.5em; display: block; padding: 0px;"><li style="margin-left: 1em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5; letter-spacing: -0.15%; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>Foster a Culture of Anticipatory Thinking</strong></p></li></ol><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">We all know those businesses that have had success in the past or that have found quick success, relying on that success for years until they became complacent and then fell behind. Nokia, Kmart, Blockbuster, and others always come to mind. To keep moving into the future and have your employees moving with you, you need to leave the legacy mindset and behavior in the past.</p><figure><img data-media-urn data-li-src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQGBUkgKlGO1ew/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1695832831119?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=C7jJ93CRqD6feFp7n5u41-9wLtMyCEdKmNkKSAenOCM" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQGBUkgKlGO1ew/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1695832831119?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=C7jJ93CRqD6feFp7n5u41-9wLtMyCEdKmNkKSAenOCM" width="480" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; margin-top: 1em; display: block; max-width: 100%;"><figcaption style="margin-top: 0.8em; text-align: center; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.5; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);"></figcaption></figure><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Trying to cling to the “glory days” often leads to a disconnected and disjointed company Futureview. So instead, encourage anticipatory thinking among all of your employees and various managers! Incentivize them to pre-solve predictable problems using my <a href="https://www.burrus.com/2023/03/with-uncertainty-all-around-hard-trends-lead-to-certainty-for-businesses-large-and-small/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Hard Trend Methodology</a>, and foster a culture of innovation in which everyone contributes and is a stakeholder.</p><ol style="margin-top: 1em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 1.5em; display: block; padding: 0px;"><li style="margin-left: 1em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5; letter-spacing: -0.15%; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>Reward the <em style="font-style: italic;">Right</em> Behaviors</strong></p></li></ol><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Believe it or not, many companies inadvertently reward counterproductive behavior. They reward knowledge hoarding, an every-person-for-themselves attitude, and chances to showboat. This leads to the breakdown of a team and fosters selfish mindsets. We have witnessed this time and again in sports teams built around one player who then goes down with an injury.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Don’t foster a culture of competition. Retaining employees involves creating dynamic reward systems based on sharing interdepartmental knowledge, having loyalty, embracing creativity, and meaningful advances in wisdom. Incentivize collaboration by teaching the importance of employee contribution. Proper incentives are a crucial asset in innovation.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">These four steps are foundational moves that you can make to align your organization’s Futureview and demonstrate to <em style="font-style: italic;">all</em> employees that you truly value them. Let me be frank once more: Larger salaries do help employees of all levels cover their living expenses adequately. But remember: They can get paid <em style="font-style: italic;">anywhere</em>. They may feel they do not have <em style="font-style: italic;">purpose</em> just anywhere, though!</p><blockquote style="margin-top: 1.5em; margin-bottom: 1.5em; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; display: block; border-width: 0; border-left-width: 4px; border-style: solid; border-left-color: #424242; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-left: 1.5em; font-size: 1em; font-style: italic; line-height: 1.5; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Employees are strategic assets to the success and <em style="font-style: italic;">significance</em> of an organization, so make sure you find a way to help them <em style="font-style: italic;">be</em> significant in their role!</p></blockquote><hr><figure><img data-media-urn data-li-src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQEjyxYMLBWEpw/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1695832866484?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=KTGwOvUg7-PYOpHbxMM5hyDQKyhi8K7N2vuWbS-3c4o" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQEjyxYMLBWEpw/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1695832866484?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=KTGwOvUg7-PYOpHbxMM5hyDQKyhi8K7N2vuWbS-3c4o" width="480" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; margin-top: 1em; display: block; max-width: 100%;"><figcaption style="margin-top: 0.8em; text-align: center; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.5; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);"></figcaption></figure><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>Download my AI Tool Recommendations Report</strong>:<a href="http://www.aiStrategyReport.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">www.aiStrategyReport.com</a></p><hr><h3 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.17em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">IF YOU ENJOYED THIS ARTICLE AND WANT MORE CONTENT LIKE THIS:</h3><p style="margin: 0; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5; letter-spacing: -0.15%; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Join Daniel Burrus\'&nbsp;<a href="https://www.burrus.com/become-anticipatory" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Anticipatory Leader Membership</a>, a results-driven online experience that will quickly help you and your team master the art of anticipatory thinking.</p></li><li style="margin-left: 1em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5; letter-spacing: -0.15%; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">You can also connect with Daniel Burrus on&nbsp;<a href="https://www.facebook.com/DanielBurrus" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; <tr> <td data-test-id="newsletter-author-lockup" class="px-3 pb-2" valign="middle" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; " style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; overflow: hidden;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/ai-science-creativity-joe-lazer-lazauskas-?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3Bcs%2Bslj1AS0q2yehLpam1LQ%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=38QlX8VepxhqY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-headline_&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-headline_-null-cmaw3x~ln1ven7x~3o-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-ln1ven7x-3o&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmVmYjY4OWM4ZDc0Njk4YWM4YzYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZjliMWFmOWY4ODU0NTgwZDAxMmNmMGEwZWNiMGNlMzAxZTBiZWM4OTU2YjY4NTcyNiwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" style="color: #0a66c2; cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%;"> <img class="block w-full" alt="Newsletter cover image" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E12AQFLwCdqDLVVlg/article-cover_image-shrink_720_1280/0/1695775608736?e=2147483647&amp;v=beta&amp;t=Vchq3V-STiH43iEU37-rUjoGC9f8ttH9oqAlLVu6iWY" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; display: block; width: 100%;"> </a> </td> </tr> <tr> <td class="py-2" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-top: 16px; padding-bottom: 16px;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/ai-science-creativity-joe-lazer-lazauskas-?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3Bcs%2Bslj1AS0q2yehLpam1LQ%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=38QlX8VepxhqY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_-null-cmaw3x~ln1ven7x~3o-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-ln1ven7x-3o&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmVmYjY4OWM4ZDc0Njk4YWM4YzYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZjliMWFmOWY4ODU0NTgwZDAxMmNmMGEwZWNiMGNlMzAxZTBiZWM4OTU2YjY4NTcyNiwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" class="no-underline font-medium text-sm m-0 text-system-gray-90" style="cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; margin: 0px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 500; color: #282828; text-decoration-line: none;"> <h2 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500;"> AI and the Science of Creativity </h2> </a> </td> </tr> <tr data-test-id="newsletter-content-preview--content"> <td class="pt-0.5 series-article-body" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; padding-top: 4px;"> <p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">This past February, I found myself in writing hell.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">I had a six-week-old baby and a demanding job running marketing at <a href="http://A.Team" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">A.Team</a>. <em style="font-style: italic;">And </em>on top of that, I was trying to write the next episode of <em style="font-style: italic;">Resignation, </em><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/hollywood-gatekeepers-said-our-tv-show-gig-workers-heres-shane-snow/?trackingId=%2BdSNCYQCRQ%2Bj%2FdTG8Xa%2F5A%3D%3D" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">the TV show I co-created with my writing partner, Shane Snow</a>.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Night after night, I’d sit in the dark on the floor of my son Max\'s nursery, my face glowing in the light of my Macbook.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">One night, Max woke up, stared straight at me, and cried. And I knew why: I looked absolutely insane. </p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">My face contorted in anguish as I tried to think of a half-decent joke. I looked like a Millennial version of Jack Nicholson in the shining. </p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">I was stuck, wasting hours, terrified that I’d let my writing partner down. And so, once I got Max back to sleep, I turned to ChatGPT to help me brainstorm. Most of its suggestions sucked, but moments later, I had the joke. Like Drano, ChatGPT had ripped through my writer’s block. I could finally move on.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">From that moment, ChatGPT became my creative companion—even though I’ve never used a sentence it’s written.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">When it comes to AI and writing, most people get the tech all wrong. As a writer, AI is mediocre. But as a creativity tool, it’s incredible. And the reason why lies in the science of how creativity works in the brain.</p><h3 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.17em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">AI and the science of creativity</h3><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">In 2014, researchers from the University of Pittsburgh <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/3032418/the-science-of-brainstorming" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">set out to understand creativity</a> by studying engineers developing innovative new products. They found that creativity doesn’t move in big leaps but in small steps.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">“Idea A spurs a new but closely related thought, which prompts another incremental step, and the chain of little mental advances sometimes eventually ends with an innovative idea in a group setting,” <a href="https://www.eurekalert.org/news-releases/717957" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">they wrote.</a></p><blockquote style="margin-top: 1.5em; margin-bottom: 1.5em; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; display: block; border-width: 0; border-left-width: 4px; border-style: solid; border-left-color: #424242; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-left: 1.5em; font-size: 1em; font-style: italic; line-height: 1.5; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">As a writer, AI is mediocre. But as a creativity tool, it’s incredible.</p></blockquote><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">For instance, a group in the study was designing a hand-held printer for kids and was trying to figure out how the door might close. One suggested it could work like a VCR tape flap. Another then suggested a garage door. Finally, a third landed on the idea of a roller door.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">You see the progression below — how each team member uses each other’s analogy as a springboard to a better idea.&nbsp;</p><figure><img data-media-urn data-li-src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E12AQGJQvl2WDKElA/article-inline_image-shrink_400_744/0/1695775814790?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=qgma6WgkzTuv1nRoNlfPLmiF-lV27KLEbISNxw32Jkg" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E12AQGJQvl2WDKElA/article-inline_image-shrink_400_744/0/1695775814790?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=qgma6WgkzTuv1nRoNlfPLmiF-lV27KLEbISNxw32Jkg" width="480" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; margin-top: 1em; display: block; max-width: 100%;"><figcaption style="margin-top: 0.8em; text-align: center; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.5; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);"></figcaption></figure><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">AI can give us unlimited ideas to jolt our creativity, and it’s already been shown to be a big boost for writers. </p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">This summer, two British researchers ran an experiment comparing writers who worked alone to write a short story to writers who used AI to help generate story ideas. The writers who used AI as a creative springboard wrote much higher quality and more novel stories than those who did not.</p><figure><img data-media-urn data-li-src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E12AQE8gXU2E0zN2w/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1695775940133?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=NX4CI-I4hjFQKw5UlKJa5klNc3WA4z02pgaj72z0lYM" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E12AQE8gXU2E0zN2w/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1695775940133?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=NX4CI-I4hjFQKw5UlKJa5klNc3WA4z02pgaj72z0lYM" width="480" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; margin-top: 1em; display: block; max-width: 100%;"><figcaption style="margin-top: 0.8em; text-align: center; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.5; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);"></figcaption></figure><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Tools like ChatGPT allow us to have brainstorming sessions on-demand. It’s like having a thousand co-workers trapped inside your computer, eagerly waiting to yell ideas at you—except their ideas will probably be better. In one recent study, ChatGPT produced <a href="https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4526071" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">stronger ideas than students in a renowned innovation class at Wharton</a>.</p><figure><img data-media-urn data-li-src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E12AQEcw9Xp8uobOg/article-inline_image-shrink_1000_1488/0/1695775859225?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=moLyhyTw6pW08z2Pif2-M5wC3qNLshUFpFLyuZ5lOJw" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E12AQEcw9Xp8uobOg/article-inline_image-shrink_1000_1488/0/1695775859225?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=moLyhyTw6pW08z2Pif2-M5wC3qNLshUFpFLyuZ5lOJw" width="480" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; margin-top: 1em; display: block; max-width: 100%;"><figcaption style="margin-top: 0.8em; text-align: center; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.5; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);"></figcaption></figure><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Of course, it’s not necessarily that important that the ideas are good. Bad ideas can just as easily catalyze those small steps of creativity that lead us to a brilliant idea.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">The beauty of AI is that it allows us to take those small steps at a much more rapid pace than we could otherwise.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">And even when the ideas <em style="font-style: italic;">are </em>good, those small steps of creativity are crucial. That Wharton study also found that while AI can produce good ideas, those ideas are similar. The wildest ideas still lie in the magic hops of the human mind.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p> </td> </tr> <tr> <td class="pt-2 no-underline" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-top: 16px; text-decoration-line: none;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" data-test-id="email-button" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; margin: 0px; padding-bottom: 8px;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/help/linkedin/answer/4788?lang=en&amp;lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3Bcs%2Bslj1AS0q2yehLpam1LQ%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=38QlX8VepxhqY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-SecurityHelp-0-footerglimmer&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-SecurityHelp-0-footerglimmer-null-cmaw3x~ln1ven7x~3o-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-ln1ven7x-3o&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmVmYjY4OWM4ZDc0Njk4YWM4YzYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZjliMWFmOWY4ODU0NTgwZDAxMmNmMGEwZWNiMGNlMzAxZTBiZWM4OTU2YjY4NTcyNiwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" style="color: #0a66c2; Others can see that you are a subscriber.</td> </tr> <tr> <td class="pb-1 m-0" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; margin: 0px; cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%;"> <img src="https://static.licdn.com/aero-v1/sc/h/9ehe6n39fa07dc5edzv0rla4e" alt="LinkedIn" class="block h-[14px] w-[56px] image-rendering-crisp" style="outline: none; <table class="row" style="border-spacing: 0; border-collapse: collapse; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 100%; position: relative; display: table; padding: 0;">\n                      <tbody>\n                        <tr style="vertical-align: top; text-align: left; padding: 0;" align="left">\n                          <th class="small-12 large-12 columns first last" style="width:      <table style="border-spacing: 0; border-collapse: collapse; vertical-align: top; text-align: left; width: 100%; padding: 0;">\n                              <tbody><tr style="vertical-align: top; text-align: left; padding: 0;" align="left">\n                                <th style="font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: normal; text-align: left; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 16px; margin: 0; padding: 0;" align="left">\n                                   <p style="line-height: 1.38; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: normal; text-align: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0pt 0; padding: 0;" align="left"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Now that you’ve seen the initial training results for your model, you can start to understand how you can improve model performance! We’ve helped thousands of people increase model accuracy and suggest the following three tactics as a starting point:</span></p>\n<p style="line-height: 1.38; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: normal; text-align: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0pt 0; padding: 0;" align="left"><b style="font-weight: normal;"><br/></b></p>\n<ul style="margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; padding-inline-start: 48px;">\n<li style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;"><p style="line-height: 1.38; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: normal; text-align: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0pt 0; padding: 0;" align="left"><a href="http://email.roboflow." style="text-decoration: none; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: bold; text-align: left; line-height: 1.6; color: #8315F9; margin: 0; padding: 0;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align:\nbaseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Data augmentation</span></a><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"> - Expand your dataset in high need areas with augmentations to add more data for underrepresented classes or classes with low accuracy.</span></p></li>\n<li style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;"><p style="line-height: 1.38; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: normal; text-align: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0pt 0; padding: 0;" align="left"><a href="http://email.roboflow." style="text-decoration: none; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: bold; text-align: left; line-height: 1.6; color: #8315F9; margin: 0; padding: 0;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip:\nnone; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Add more data</span></a><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"> - Use open source data from one of the 1000,000+ Roboflow Universe projects to increase the size of your dataset. </span></p></li>\n<li style="list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;"><p style="line-height: 1.38; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: normal; text-align: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0pt 0; padding: 0;" align="left"><a href="http://email.roboflow." style="text-decoration: none; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: bold; text-align: left; line-height: 1.6; color: #8315F9; margin: 0; padding: 0;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none;\ntext-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Active learning</span></a><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;"> - Sample data from your production application to bring specific real world data into your dataset</span></p></li>\n</ul>\n<p style="line-height: 1.38; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: normal; text-align: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0pt 0; padding: 0;" align="left"><b style="font-weight: normal;"><br/></b></p>\n<p style="line-height: 1.38; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: normal; text-align: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0pt 0; padding: 0;" align="left"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">Taking a data-centric approach to model improvement can yield great results and ensure your machine learning pipeline is enabling you to continually generate better results. </span></p>\n<p style="line-height: 1.38; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: normal; text-align: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0pt 0; padding: 0;" align="left"><br/><a href="http://email.roboflow." style="text-decoration-line: none; opacity: 0; mso-hide: all;" data-email-preheader="true">Too many teams overvalue busyness, fostering cultures of long work hours…</div> <div class="h-0 opacity-0 text-transparent invisible overflow-hidden w-0 max-h-[0]" style="visibility: hidden; height: 0px; max-height: 0; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; opacity: 0; mso-hide: all;"> ͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp; ͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp;͏&nbsp; line-height: 1.25; color: #0a66c2;"> Open on Linkedin</span> </a> </td> </tr> <tr data-test-id="newsletter-content-preview"> <td class="px-3 pt-2" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-left: 24px; padding-right: 24px; padding-top: 16px;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" " style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; overflow: hidden;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/examine-your-teams-culture-busyness-harvard-business-review?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BtRZp%2BeRUR8uecipNl1OdxA%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=0MJMEfp-DdgGY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-headline_&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-headline_-null-cmaw3x~ln17ttxb~p0-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-ln17ttxb-p0&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmUwYmM4OGNlZDU0Nzk4YWM4NzYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZjg5NGFlYWZmYzQ1ZDgwZTJkMTExNWExN2JmZDZjZmRkMGJiOWM4MjFlYzk2NmIxMywxLDE%3D" target="_blank" style="color: #0a66c2; cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%;"> <img class="block w-full" alt="Newsletter cover image" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4D12AQGQkHDc3FGnnQ/article-cover_image-shrink_720_1280/0/1695784947827?e=2147483647&amp;v=beta&amp;t=zIq7VdzbSNEq9ImCMzIC7cliPe5hWTXjiHzAdLmf920" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; display: block; width: 100%;"> </a> </td> </tr> <tr> <td class="py-2" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-top: 16px; padding-bottom: 16px;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/examine-your-teams-culture-busyness-harvard-business-review?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BtRZp%2BeRUR8uecipNl1OdxA%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=0MJMEfp-DdgGY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_-null-cmaw3x~ln17ttxb~p0-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-ln17ttxb-p0&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmUwYmM4OGNlZDU0Nzk4YWM4NzYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZjg5NGFlYWZmYzQ1ZDgwZTJkMTExNWExN2JmZDZjZmRkMGJiOWM4MjFlYzk2NmIxMywxLDE%3D" target="_blank" class="no-underline font-medium text-sm m-0 text-system-gray-90" style="cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; margin: 0px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 500; color: #282828; text-decoration-line: none;"> <h2 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500;"> Examine Your Team’s Culture of Busyness </h2> </a> </td> </tr> <tr data-test-id="newsletter-content-preview--content"> <td class="pt-0.5 series-article-body" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; padding-top: 4px;"> <p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Too many teams overvalue busyness, fostering cultures of long work hours, meeting overload, and chronic multitasking. But our obsession with staying busy is&nbsp;misguided—and it can actually come at the expense of productivity. Here’s how to reverse the destructive trend.</p><ul style="margin-top: 1em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 1.5em; display: block; padding: 0px;"><li style="margin-left: 1em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5; letter-spacing: -0.15%; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>Reward output, not just activity.</strong>&nbsp;Recognize and promote employees who work efficiently and produce the highest-quality&nbsp;work—not just those who log the most hours.</p></li><li style="margin-left: 1em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5; letter-spacing: -0.15%; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>Eliminate low-value work and foster deep work.</strong>&nbsp;Conduct an audit on your team to determine how much time per week&nbsp;they spend on shallow tasks versus the time they spend deeply focused on high-value tasks. If the results are skewed toward low-value work, help them reprioritize, delegate, and eliminate the busy work that’s getting in the way of real productivity.</p></li><li style="margin-left: 1em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5; letter-spacing: -0.15%; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>Nudge people off the clock.</strong>&nbsp;If you want your employees to truly thrive, you need to allow time for their minds&nbsp;to wander. Encourage them to sign off earlier, work less on weekends, and (crucially) actually use their allotted vacation time.</p></li><li style="margin-left: 1em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5; letter-spacing: -0.15%; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>Model the right behavior.</strong>&nbsp;The boldest leaders aren’t those who burn the midnight oil; they’re the ones who set&nbsp;the norm by taking a pause. When you show that your own busyness isn’t a prerequisite for success, others are more likely to follow suit.</p></li></ul><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Read the full article: “<a href="https://hbr.org/2023/03/beware-a-culture-of-busyness?utm_campaign=hbr&amp;utm_medium=social&amp;utm_source=linkedinnewsletter&amp;tpcc=linkedinnewsletter" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Beware a Culture of Busyness</a>.” </p><hr><figure><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/events/7111049625985327104/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><img data-media-urn data-li-src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4D12AQH_jearc33e0A/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1695785239017?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=vtMDQz9-qdNyoDw3X6k8A2E2vjqYSAMc3fsANsiQfjs" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4D12AQH_jearc33e0A/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1695785239017?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=vtMDQz9-qdNyoDw3X6k8A2E2vjqYSAMc3fsANsiQfjs" width="480" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; margin-top: 1em; display: block; max-width: 100%;"></a><figcaption style="margin-top: 0.8em; text-align: center; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.5; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);"></figcaption></figure><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Join us this Thursday, 9/28, for The New World of Work season finale with Whole Foods Market CEO Jason Buechel. We’ll talk about how he’s approached purpose, sustainability, and growth in the new world of work. We\'ll be taking your questions for the CEO and answering them live. <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/events/7111049625985327104/comments/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; font-weight: 500;"> Current State of Vector Databases with Sanjeev Mohan </h2> </a> </td> </tr> <tr data-test-id="newsletter-content-preview--content"> <td class="pt-0.5 series-article-body" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; padding-top: 4px;"> <p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://mltblog.com/3Zv75Mk" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Register here</a> for this 60-min live session, Wednesday, September 27. If you can\'t make this date/time, you will automatically receive a copy of the webinar video recording and GitHub assets via email after the live session.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>Summary</strong></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">The landscape of vector databases is shifting rapidly, influencing the way engineering teams approach AI and data pipelines. As organizations grapple with optimizing architecture for generative AI, understanding the nuances of vector databases becomes critical. Join Sanjeev Mohan, a former VP at Gartner, as he deciphers the intricate world of vector databases, offering technical insights tailored for engineering leadership.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>What You’ll Learn:</strong></p><ul style="margin-top: 1em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 1.5em; display: block; padding: 0px;"><li style="margin-left: 1em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5; letter-spacing: -0.15%; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Technical deep-dive into vector embeddings and their pivotal role in modern AI architectures.</p></li><li style="margin-left: 1em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5; letter-spacing: -0.15%; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Key considerations in constructing efficient AI pipelines and integrating vector search capabilities.</p></li><li style="margin-left: 1em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5; letter-spacing: -0.15%; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Best practices in evaluating and selecting vector-enabled databases for scalable applications.</p></li><li style="margin-left: 1em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5; letter-spacing: -0.15%; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Architectural and performance nuances of leading vector databases in the market.</p></li><li style="margin-left: 1em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5; letter-spacing: -0.15%; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Strategies to ensure seamless deployment, security, and operational excellence with vector databases.</p></li></ul><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">To register, <a href="https://mltblog.com/3Zv75Mk" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%;
