src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQH8sezucLwNzQ/article-cover_image-shrink_720_1280/0/1695670211070?e=2147483647&amp;v=beta&amp;t=2sAeD-5PFCfXcKB1IKPDqifXe61whoq2QQYnerlF_JI" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; display: block; width: 100%;"> </a> </td> </tr> <tr> <td class="py-2" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-top: 16px; padding-bottom: 16px;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/what-takes-build-keep-great-work-culture-marcel-schwantes?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3Buvl3AQ60R2KtRA1%2BSu4gAg%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=3B_N9oXOr1fWY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_-null-cmaw3x~ln0fyual~w8-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-ln0fyual-w8&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmUwYjA4ZmNjZDY0MTk4YWY4OTYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZjgxNDFiNWJiZjQwN2E5ZThkMWFkNTAwOWQzMTdlYmY5NDJlYmMyODBlMDdkN2ZkNiwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" class="no-underline font-medium text-sm m-0 text-system-gray-90" style="cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; margin: 0px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 500; color: #282828; text-decoration-line: none;"> <h2 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500;"> What It Takes to Build and Keep a Great Work Culture </h2> </a> </td> </tr> <tr data-test-id="newsletter-content-preview--content"> <td class="pt-0.5 series-article-body" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; padding-top: 4px;"> <p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><em style="font-style: italic;">Join over 367,000 people and&nbsp;</em><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/newsletters/the-future-of-leadership-6721831952871157760/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><em style="font-style: italic;">subscribe here</em></a><em style="font-style: italic;">&nbsp;for future editions.&nbsp;Event Planners: Scroll to the bottom of this post to explore keynotes for your speaking calendar.</em></p><h3 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.17em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;"> * * * *</h3><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Management consultant and author Peter Drucker&nbsp;is known for once having said, "Culture eats strategy for breakfast."&nbsp;Or did he?</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">My sources indicate that this quote was actually popularized&nbsp;in 2006 by Mark Fields, chief executive&nbsp;at Ford. Drucker, according to the <a href="https://drucker.institute/did-peter-drucker-say-that/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Drucker Institute</a>, never said it verbatim. He actually said, "Culture—no matter how defined—is singularly persistent.”</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Whatever the case (and feel free to debate in the comments), the quote has been immortalized in the business lexicon, and for good reason: <em style="font-style: italic;">Culture matters</em>.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">The premise held by Drucker and Fields is&nbsp;that a company\'s culture will trump&nbsp;any effort by a management team to enforce a strategy that is incompatible with that culture. In the end, it\'s the culture that wins.</p><h3 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.17em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">A winning culture comes down to leadership</h3><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Ensuring that your culture and its beliefs, behaviors, and values become sustainable over time falls squarely on the shoulders of senior leaders as "<strong>caretakers of the culture.</strong>" They champion the company\'s identity&nbsp;and protect its culture&nbsp;for competitive advantage.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">They are also the caretakers of the <em style="font-style: italic;">people</em> that make up the culture -- its employees, who then are held responsible for living out the tenets that hold the culture together.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Folks, we\'re talking about "hire and fire" stuff here. And performance planning and promoting people for the right roles.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">But what makes these caretakers of the culture stand out from a leadership standpoint?</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">As you inspect these leaders closer, as I have over two decades of coaching leaders, here\'s what you will visibly see in action, day in and day out.</p><h3 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.17em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">1. They invite&nbsp;feedback</h3><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">It takes&nbsp;humility, an open mind, and&nbsp;a lot of active listening&nbsp;with employees\' interests in mind to be open to feedback. As caretakers of the culture, good leaders&nbsp;will ask peers and&nbsp;respected high-performers&nbsp;the tough question, "How am I doing as a leader?" And then they listen. They are truly interested in receiving honest feedback so they can grow&nbsp;themselves and others.&nbsp;</p><h3 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.17em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">2. They play for the team</h3><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Leaders that forge ahead with a win-at-all-costs mentality--at the benefit of some and&nbsp;the expense of others--will quickly create silos, alienate people, and lose&nbsp;the respect of the whole. Caretakers of great company cultures don\'t seek the glory or take the credit; they empower their people to do all the work, brainstorm solutions that add value and benefit the whole team, and give them all the glory after a great effort.&nbsp;</p><h3 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.17em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">3. They promote safety and trust</h3><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Leaders championing a company\'s culture&nbsp;need&nbsp;to ask a very important&nbsp;question:&nbsp;"Does my behavior increase trust?" If you want to ensure your culture is safe and its common set of values are held&nbsp;tightly without being violated, trust is a non-negotiable pillar that every person -- leaders,&nbsp;employees, and other stakeholders alike --&nbsp;should stand on.&nbsp;</p><h3 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.17em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">4. They are selfless</h3><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">In the book&nbsp;<a href="https://servantleadership.bkconnection.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><em style="font-style: italic;">Servant Leadership in Action: How You Can Achieve Great Relationships and Results</em></a><em style="font-style: italic;">,&nbsp;</em>Raj Sisodia, cofounder&nbsp;of&nbsp;<a href="https://www.consciouscapitalism.org/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Conscious Capitalism</a>, writes:</p><blockquote style="margin-top: 1.5em; margin-bottom: 1.5em; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; display: block; border-width: 0; border-left-width: 4px; border-style: solid; border-left-color: #424242; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-left: 1.5em; font-size: 1em; font-style: italic; line-height: 1.5; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">A leader who operates with a primary emphasis on self-interest naturally views other people as a means to that end. You cannot be a true leader if you operate at that level of consciousness. Selfless does not mean eradicating the ego...it is about harnessing the ego in healthy ways. As the Dalai Lama has said, \'[W]e must make sure it is a&nbsp;<em style="font-style: italic;">serving</em>&nbsp;ego and not a&nbsp;<em style="font-style: italic;">deserving</em>&nbsp;ego.\'</p></blockquote><h3 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.17em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">5. They have faith in their workers</h3><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">In a&nbsp;<a href="https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/news/steve-jobs-in-1994-the-rolling-stone-interview-20110117" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">conversation</a>&nbsp;with&nbsp;<em style="font-style: italic;">Rolling&nbsp;Stone</em>&nbsp;magazine&nbsp;at&nbsp;one of the lowest points of his stellar career, the late&nbsp;<a href="http://inc.com/marcel-schwantes/first-90-days-steve-jobs-advice-on-the-only-4-times-you-should-say-no.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Steve&nbsp;Jobs</a>&nbsp;said: </p><blockquote style="margin-top: 1.5em; margin-bottom: 1.5em; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; display: block; border-width: 0; border-left-width: 4px; border-style: solid; border-left-color: #424242; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-left: 1.5em; font-size: 1em; font-style: italic; line-height: 1.5; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">"What\'s important is that you have a faith in people, that they\'re basically good and smart,&nbsp;and if you give them tools, they\'ll do wonderful things with them."&nbsp;</p></blockquote><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">As Jobs evolved as a leader, he demonstrated increasing faith in his employees. As caretakers of the culture, you adopt&nbsp;a "trust first" mindset&nbsp;before trust is earned because you accept and believe&nbsp;in your&nbsp;employees\' abilities&nbsp;to use their brains and talents to create&nbsp;and innovate.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><em style="font-style: italic;">Your turn: What other qualities would you say make up a "caretaker" of a good company culture? Leave a comment and let\'s learn from each other.</em></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><hr><h2 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.5em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">Virtual and In-Person Keynotes in 2024</h2><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Fall is here and event conference planners are busy working to fill their speaking roster in 2024. If your organization is interested in a virtual or in-person keynote,&nbsp;<a href="https://calendly.com/marcelschwantes/15-minute-discovery-call-for-keynotes?month=2023-04" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><strong>click here</strong></a>&nbsp;or below to schedule a call with me so I can personally hear about your event and whether I\'m a good fit. Serious speaking inquiries only.</p><figure><a href="https://calendly.com/marcelschwantes/15-minute-discovery-call-for-keynotes?month=2023-09" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><img data-media-urn data-li-src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQHxyt1sz8rYKA/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1695737966242?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=snl9ma_aEIX4V1sag4t7JFeL-c28mymqOaj-lbSnPGs" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQHxyt1sz8rYKA/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1695737966242?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=snl9ma_aEIX4V1sag4t7JFeL-c28mymqOaj-lbSnPGs" width="480" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; margin-top: 1em; display: block; max-width: 100%;"></a><figcaption style="margin-top: 0.8em; text-align: center; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.5; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);"></figcaption></figure><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">=====================</p><h3 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.17em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">About Marcel Schwantes</h3><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://www.marcelschwantes.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Marcel Schwantes</a>&nbsp;is a global speaker whose keynotes and workshops spotlight the human side of work and how cultures of care, connection, and belonging outperform the competition. He\'s an executive coach, syndicated columnist with a worldwide following, and the creator of the highly-acclaimed "<a href="https://www.marcelschwantes.com/virtual-training/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">From Boss to Leader</a>" course. Marcel has been recognized as one of the "Top 101 Global Employee Engagement &amp; Experience Influencers" by Inspiring Workplaces. His work is regularly featured in&nbsp;media outlets all over the world, including Inc., Business Insider, Fast Company, and CNBC.</p> </td> </tr> <tr> <td class="pt-2 no-underline" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-top: 16px; text-decoration-line: none;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" data-test-id="email-button" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; min-height: auto !important; box-shadow: 0 0 #0000, 0 0 #0000, 0 0 #0000 !important;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/what-takes-build-keep-great-work-culture-marcel-schwantes?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3Buvl3AQ60R2KtRA1%2BSu4gAg%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=3B_N9oXOr1fWY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-readmore_button_&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-readmore_button_-null-cmaw3x~ln0fyual~w8-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-ln0fyual-w8&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmUwYjA4ZmNjZDY0MTk4YWY4OTYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZjgxNDFiNWJiZjQwN2E5ZThkMWFkNTAwOWQzMTdlYmY5NDJlYmMyODBlMDdkN2ZkNiwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" tabindex="-1" aria-hidden="true" style="color: #0a66c2; cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%;"> <span class="no-underline text-white" style="color: #ffffff; text-decoration-line: none;"> Join the conversation </span> </a> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> </a> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> </td> </tr> <tr> <td class="pt-2 px-3" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-left: 24px; padding-right: 24px; padding-top: 16px;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; Share it with them. </td> </tr> <tr> <td class="pt-2" align="center" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-top: 16px;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="75%" class="mx-auto" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; font-weight: 500;"> The Simple Strategy This CEO Of A 30,000 Person Company Uses To Make Tough Decisions </h2> </a> </td> </tr> <tr data-test-id="newsletter-content-preview--content"> <td class="pt-0.5 series-article-body" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; padding-top: 4px;"> <p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">How do you make tough decisions? </p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Today’s leadership hack comes from Adam Warby, CEO Emeritus at Avanade, a 30,000 person consulting company. He has been with the company for over 15 years, playing an instrumental role in building and shaping the company to be what it is today. During his time, Adam had to make a lot of tough decisions which were oftentimes uncomfortable yet impactful.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">In today’s video, I’ll share the simple approach that Adam used during his tenure as CEO to make tough decisions. </p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://greatleadership.substack.com/p/adam-warby-ceo-avanade-tough-decisions-leader" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Subscribe and get the video here,</a> </p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">OR</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">You can get <a href="https://greatleadership.substack.com/p/adam-warby-ceo-avanade-tough-decisions-leader" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-top: 16px; padding-bottom: 16px;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/best-smart-watches-2023-2024-from-blood-sugar-monitoring-bernard-marr?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3B0XWL9moPS9GiOoU6syTNsQ%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=1Ro6KvWtbxfqY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_-null-cmaw3x~lmzytfl5~26-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-lmzytfl5-26&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmUwYjU4ZWNhZDU0MjkxYTg4ZjYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZmViNzBlY2I4ODI1MWFlZmYwZTQ5OTFjMmNjYjlmZWU0NjVlMGJjZmNlYTg3M2JmZSwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" class="no-underline font-medium text-sm m-0 text-system-gray-90" style="cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; margin: 0px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 500; color: #282828; text-decoration-line: none;"> <h2 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500;"> The Best Smart Watches In 2023 / 2024: From Blood Sugar Monitoring To AI Personal Training </h2> </a> </td> </tr> <tr data-test-id="newsletter-content-preview--content"> <td class="pt-0.5 series-article-body" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; padding-top: 4px;"> <p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Thank you for reading my latest article&nbsp;<strong>The Best Smart Watches In 2023 / 2024: From Blood Sugar Monitoring To AI Personal Training</strong>.&nbsp;Here at&nbsp;<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/bernardmarr/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">LinkedIn</a>&nbsp;and at&nbsp;<a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/bernardmarr/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Forbes</a>&nbsp;I regularly write about management and technology trends.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">To read my future articles simply join my network by clicking \'Follow\'. Also feel free to connect with me via&nbsp;<a href="https://twitter.com/BernardMarr" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Twitter</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://en-gb.facebook.com/BernardWMarr/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Facebook</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://www.instagram.com/bernard.marr" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Instagram</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://bernardmarr.com/podcasts/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Podcast</a>&nbsp;or&nbsp;<a href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWstLaT61QUc-TvfxOjNpFw" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">YouTube</a>.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Apple popularized the smartwatch, just as it did with the smartphone when it released the Apple watch in 2015. But it wasn’t the first – IBM released the <a href="https://techcrunch.com/gallery/the-smartwatches-that-paved-the-way/slide/4/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">WatchPad</a>, which ran on a cut-down version of the Linux operating system way back in 2001. And who remembers the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2016/dec/08/kickstarter-pebble-shut-down" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Pebble</a>? Funded via a Kickstarter campaign in 2011, it was one of the first watches to pair with a smartphone to deliver notifications to your wrist.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">And smartwatch makers continue to innovate by adding new features and functions, as well as producing sleeker, lighter and more user-friendly designs. Here’s a roundup of some of the most exciting and interesting watches that have hit the market recently, along with a few glimpses of what watch-loving gadget heads can expect to see in the near future.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://consumer.huawei.com/en/wearables/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Huawei Watch 4</a>/ Watch 4 Pro</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Huawei has launched the first watch to feature <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZWOCwntoNFU" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">non-invasive blood glucose monitoring</a>. This is a feature that other watchmakers, including Apple, have been aiming to develop for some time, but the Chinese manufacturer is the first to market. The device doesn’t measure blood sugar levels directly; instead, it tracks a number of other health metrics that can be used to give indicators of high or low blood sugar levels. This means it won’t replace invasive blood sugar monitors that require diabetics to prick their finger to draw blood, but it can still be used to provide early warning of a hyperglycemic or hypoglycemic episode.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://www.apple.com/apple-watch-ultra/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Apple Watch Ultra</a></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Available now for about a year, the Ultra has carved out a place for itself as the top-end watch in Apple\'s ever-growing lineup. It distinguishes itself by having a titanium exterior, designed to be durable in extreme conditions, and enabling it to boast a water resistance of up to 600 meters. New battery technology has also enabled Apple to extend the battery life – not a strong point of earlier models – to a useful 36 hours. For these reasons, it’s marketed as a watch for adventurers or lovers of extreme sports – if this describes you, you might also want to check out the <a href="https://www.garmin.com/en-US/p/735611" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Garmin Fenix 7</a> or the <a href="https://www.polar.com/us-en/grit-x-pro" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Polar Grit X Pro</a> watches.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://www.androidpolice.com/google-pixel-watch-2-faces-leak-online-showcasing-dynamic-theming/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Google Pixel Watch 2</a></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Rumors have it that the second iteration of Google\'s smartwatch will feature an enhanced version of the Body Response stress detection system featured in the Fitbit Sense 2. This would make sense as Fitbit is owned by Google, and it may want to include the most sophisticated elements of its subsidiary’s technology in its own flagship device. While previous versions of the stress detection technology leverage machine learning to monitor a number of metrics, including perspiration, heart rate and skin temperature, to provide a daily score, the latest Body Response system enables real-time reporting that can send an alert when it detects a rise in stress levels.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://www.amazfit.com/products/amazfit-cheetah-pro" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Amazfit Cheetah</a></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Generative AI comes to smartwatches, thanks to the Cheetah\'s Zepp AI coaching application. This watch incorporates a large language model that enables it to answer questions and provide information as if you had a personal trainer strapped to your wrist. It also offers AI-powered advice and guidance on your training program, including personalized recommendations and GPS routing.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://cameratechdaily.com/2023/06/27/fitbit-ace-4/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Fitbit Ace 4</a></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Rumored to be launching later in the year, this is the latest version of Fitbit\'s range of fitness tracker watches specifically designed for children. As well as parental controls, it features a kid-friendly design, a high level of customization, and kid-friendly versions of Fitbit apps with a focus on fun and gamification of fitness activities. A rugged design helps it to stand up to the trips, falls and spills that are all too often a part of children’s lives.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://www.citizenwatch.co.uk/cz-smart-technology" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Citizen Smart Touchscreen Gen-2</a></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Another AI-assisted watch, Citizen\'s latest model, is powered by IBM\'s Watson AI engine. This takes the form of a built-in <em style="font-style: italic;">self-care advisor</em> designed to build up an intelligent understanding of the wearer’s lifestyle, physical health and activity levels. It also leverages machine learning algorithms developed by NASA to help understand the day-to-day alertness and energy level fluctuations experienced by astronauts to provide automated suggestions on the best times to exert yourself or rest in order to efficiently use energy throughout the day.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">To stay on top of the latest on new and emerging business and tech trends, make sure to subscribe to&nbsp;<a href="https://lp.constantcontactpages.com/su/Tvmg4PM/newsletter" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">LinkedIn</a>, and <a href="https://www.youtube.com/user/bernardmarr" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>About Bernard Marr</strong></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Bernard Marr is a world-renowned futurist, influencer and thought leader in the fields of business and technology, with a passion for using technology for the good of humanity. He is a&nbsp;<a href="https://bernardmarr.com/books/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">best-selling and award-winning author of 22 books</a>, writes a regular column for Forbes and advises and coaches many of the world’s best-known organisations. He has over 2 million social media followers, 1.8 million newsletter subscribers and was ranked by LinkedIn as one of the top 5 business influencers in the world and the No 1 influencer in the UK.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Bernard’s latest books are ‘Business Trends in Practice: The 25+ Trends That Are Redefining Organisations’, ‘Future Skills: The 20 Skills and Competencies Everyone Needs To Succeed In A Digital World’ and ‘The Future Internet: How the Metaverse, Web 3.0, and Blockchain Will Transform Business and Society’.</p><figure><a href="https://bernardmarr.com/books/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; padding-top: 4px;"> <p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">You are now&nbsp;1 million+&nbsp;readers&nbsp;to receive this weekly newsletter – thank you for your support! This newsletter celebrates&nbsp;<a href="http://www.intelligentautomationbook.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Intelligent Automation</a>\'s&nbsp;most significant advancements in&nbsp;making our world more human.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">The 5 news you can\'t miss this week:</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>1️⃣ </strong>[Tech] Microsoft has just unveiled its <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-09-21/microsoft-is-rolling-out-generative-ai-in-windows-and-office-app#xj4y7vzkg" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">new AI assistant named Copilot</a>, integrated with Windows 11 and its 365 productivity suite, offering features like content generation and voice or text command control for desktop experience.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Set to <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2023/9/21/23882074/microsoft-surface-copilot-event-2023-biggest-announcements" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">launch on September 26</a> for Windows 11 users and November 1 for Microsoft 365 enterprise customers, Copilot is powered by GPT-4 and will be available for <a href="https://fortune.com/2023/07/18/microsoft-office-365-copilot-openai-30-dollars-per-month/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">a $30 per user per month fee</a> for business accounts across various applications.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The assistant facilitates access to web data and internal company information, streamlining tasks such as slideshow creation, spreadsheet analysis, and document summaries.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>2️⃣ </strong>[Regulation] Senate Minority Whip John Thune plans to introduce <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2023/09/20/thune-klobuchar-ai-bill-00117236" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">a bill requiring AI companies to self-certify the safety of high-risk AI systems</a>, aiming for a balanced approach to AI governance that mitigates risks without stifling innovation.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; If passed, the legislation would mandate companies to assess and ensure the safety of their AI applications, with the U.S. Commerce Department overseeing regulation enforcement.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The senators are seeking additional cosponsors before officially presenting the bill. </p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>3️⃣</strong> [Mental Health] <a href="https://apnews.com/article/kai-koerber-app-joy-parkland-shooting-4136f37269a175304e0b8953e523bbe5" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Parkland school shooting survivor, Kai Koerber, has launched "Joy: AI Wellness Platform,"</a> an AI-powered app that recommends mindfulness activities based on users\' vocal emotions, becoming more accurate with increased usage.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Available for <a href="https://apps.apple.com/us/app/joy-ai-wellness-platform/id1618609385" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">iPhones at $8 a month,</a> the app allows users to verbally interact with it, receiving suggestions like "mindful consumption" or writing a letter, and offers manual mood selection if the initial interpretation is incorrect.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>4️⃣</strong> [Tech] <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2023/9/19/23872888/intel-meteor-lake-core-ultra-date-chip-specs-details" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Intel is releasing a new chip called "Meteor Lake" on December 14,</a> which <a href="https://www.reuters.com/technology/intel-says-newest-laptop-chips-software-will-handle-generative-ai-2023-09-19/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">will let laptops run AI services like chatbots directly,</a> without needing to connect to the cloud.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; This chip uses a special unit for AI tasks, making services faster and keeping sensitive data on the device.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <a href="https://www.anandtech.com/show/18911/intel-new-core-branding-for-meteor-lake-no-i-new-ultra-tier" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">The feature</a> was showcased using an Acer Swift laptop <a href="https://www.pcmag.com/news/first-intel-meteor-lake-cpus-to-arrive-dec-14-through-core-ultra-brand" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">running an AI image generator locally</a>. </p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>5️⃣ </strong>[Medicine] DeepMind has created a new AI tool called <a href="https://www.technologyreview.com/2023/09/19/1079871/deepmind-alphamissense-ai-pinpoint-causes-genetic-disease/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">AlphaMissense</a> that can guess which DNA changes might <a href="https://www.deepmind.com/blog/alphamissense-catalogue-of-genetic-mutations-to-help-pinpoint-the-cause-of-diseases" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">cause diseases</a> like cancer and cystic fibrosis.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; This tool looked at 71 million tiny DNA changes and sorted them into groups like “safe” and “possibly harmful,” to help doctors find and treat diseases faster.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The information from AlphaMissense, building on DeepMind\'s <a href="https://www.deepmind.com/research/highlighted-research/alphafold" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">AlphaFold program</a>, is being <a href="https://zenodo.org/record/8208688" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">shared for free</a> to help scientists and doctors study and understand diseases better.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><figure><a href="https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/startups/ai" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; September 24, 2023 </h2> </a> </td> </tr> <tr data-test-id="newsletter-content-preview--content"> <td class="pt-0.5 series-article-body" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; padding-top: 4px;"> <p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Welcome to the fourteenth edition of the experimental series <em style="font-style: italic;">Leading Edge 120 </em>by the <a href="https://www.innovativeleadershipinstitute.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Innovative Leadership Institute</a>. Each video is a 120-second (more or less!) look at a major news story from the prior week through the lens of leadership. The intent is to keep you current as a leader in a quick and easily digestible format. In this episode, <a href="https://www.innovativeleadershipinstitute.com/about-us/our-team/maureen-metcalf/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Maureen Metcalf</a> and <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/gsmoran/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Greg Moran</a> discuss how great leaders win without making others lose. Please help us shape this new content format by providing feedback in the comments!</p><div><table class="email-iframe-wrapper" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; text-decoration-line: none;"> <span class="text-sm m-0 text-cool-gray-70 break-words font-normal leading-regular" style="margin: 0px; overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; line-height: 1.25; color: #56687a;"> Focusing on my four tenets of equanimity and teaching people to define success on their terms. </span> </a> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> </td> </tr> <tr> <td data-test-id="newsletter-author-lockup" class="px-3 pb-2" valign="middle" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-left: 24px; padding-right: 24px; padding-bottom: 16px;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td valign="middle" align="left" class="pr-1 w-4" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; width: 32px; padding-right: 8px;" width="32"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/in/steve-wohlenhaus?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BY4dZVDMjTh%2BBAOZT8VgRJA%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=3mGKHmFxYCfaY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_author_lockup-0-newsletter_author_cta&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_author_lockup-0-newsletter_author_cta-null-cmaw3x~lmziqrwr~93-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-lmziqrwr-93&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmUxYmM4YmM2ZDk0OTljYWM4NjYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZmViMWJjOGQwZTYwMWEzY2JhNDFjMTc4ODY1NGYzMzMxNWM4NGExZDA1OTM3OTk0MCwxLDE%3D" padding-top: 16px; padding-bottom: 16px; line-height: 1.25;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/6-things-improve-how-we-use-time-greater-success-steve-wohlenhaus?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BY4dZVDMjTh%2BBAOZT8VgRJA%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=3mGKHmFxYCfaY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_hero_banner-0-open_on_linkedin_cta&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_hero_banner-0-open_on_linkedin_cta-null-cmaw3x~lmziqrwr~93-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-lmziqrwr-93&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmUxYmM4YmM2ZDk0OTljYWM4NjYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZmViMWJjOGQwZTYwMWEzY2JhNDFjMTc4ODY1NGYzMzMxNWM4NGExZDA1OTM3OTk0MCwxLDE%3D" line-height: 1.25; color: #0a66c2;"> Open on Linkedin</span> </a> </td> </tr> <tr data-test-id="newsletter-content-preview"> <td class="px-3 pt-2" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-left: 24px; padding-right: 24px; padding-top: 16px;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td class="overflow-hidden " style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; overflow: hidden;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/6-things-improve-how-we-use-time-greater-success-steve-wohlenhaus?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BY4dZVDMjTh%2BBAOZT8VgRJA%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=3mGKHmFxYCfaY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-headline_&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-headline_-null-cmaw3x~lmziqrwr~93-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-lmziqrwr-93&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmUxYmM4YmM2ZDk0OTljYWM4NjYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZmViMWJjOGQwZTYwMWEzY2JhNDFjMTc4ODY1NGYzMzMxNWM4NGExZDA1OTM3OTk0MCwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" style="color: #0a66c2; cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%;"> <img class="block w-full" alt="Newsletter cover image" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQGUAttAZNOcSA/article-cover_image-shrink_720_1280/0/1694525673322?e=2147483647&amp;v=beta&amp;t=-TYGAYJVSj9le1QeBZB2jJ96k4lcP_V1zWDK2f2_zG0" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; display: block; width: 100%;"> </a> </td> </tr> <tr> <td class="py-2" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-top: 16px; padding-bottom: 16px;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/6-things-improve-how-we-use-time-greater-success-steve-wohlenhaus?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BY4dZVDMjTh%2BBAOZT8VgRJA%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=3mGKHmFxYCfaY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_-null-cmaw3x~lmziqrwr~93-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-lmziqrwr-93&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmUxYmM4YmM2ZDk0OTljYWM4NjYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZmViMWJjOGQwZTYwMWEzY2JhNDFjMTc4ODY1NGYzMzMxNWM4NGExZDA1OTM3OTk0MCwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" class="no-underline font-medium text-sm m-0 text-system-gray-90" style="cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; margin: 0px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 500; color: #282828; text-decoration-line: none;"> <h2 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500;"> 6 things that will improve how we use time for greater success. </h2> </a> </td> </tr> <tr data-test-id="newsletter-content-preview--content"> <td class="pt-0.5 series-article-body" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; padding-top: 4px;"> <p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Success for me was always a combination of achieving financial freedom, but also demanded “owning my time”.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Like so many ideas that get circulated indiscriminately, "time management" is a term that implies using time for the purpose of being “more productive”.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">If our relationship with time is contingent upon “productivity”, we spend less time cultivating “purpose”.&nbsp; Our focus is dedicated to “getting more done” not being infinite.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">In the process we create stress, anxiety, and often resentment.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Many people have invested heavily in the hustle culture that celebrates squeezing every second from each day in the spirit of “productivity”.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Productivity is important, but not at the expense of self-care and wellbeing.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">When we embrace a new perspective about time, we focus on setting boundaries, exercising discipline, emphasize health, and define our values.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Productivity falls into place when we eliminate distractions and operate at peak efficiency compliments of making time work to our advantage.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Maybe its time for a slightly new perspective on “time management”.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong><em style="font-style: italic;">“Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four-hour days.”&nbsp; Zig Ziglar</em></strong></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>Here are 6 reasons why managing time differently pays off:</strong></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><figure><a href="https://weatherology.com/apps/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><img data-media-urn data-li-src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQHMZ8HE4GfoAA/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1694526213996?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=Iked02g2HKX5Xd2_73TNHf1jfBkfz9mUju5ss_M1w8U" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQHMZ8HE4GfoAA/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1694526213996?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=Iked02g2HKX5Xd2_73TNHf1jfBkfz9mUju5ss_M1w8U" width="480" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; margin-top: 1em; display: block; max-width: 100%;"></a><figcaption style="margin-top: 0.8em; text-align: center; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.5; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);"></figcaption></figure><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>More</strong></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Many companies push people harder with the intention of extracting <strong>“more”</strong>.&nbsp; In the process, we burn people out and force good people to seek opportunities elsewhere.&nbsp; The research shows working more than 55 hours each week is counterproductive.&nbsp; It’s ironic that many businesses expect people to be on call 24 hours a day, and demand “more”.&nbsp; Make deliverables the objective, not the number of hours people work. The same principle can apply when creating a schedule that complements our “lifestyle”.&nbsp; More isn’t always the answer.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong><em style="font-style: italic;">“The bad news is time flies. The good news is you’re the pilot.”</em></strong></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>Motivation</strong></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">When people get married to the idea of needing “more time” to get things done, the pressure we create depletes motivation.&nbsp; New studies show time management techniques that are most effective long term don’t rely on willpower and effort, they become automatic.&nbsp; By establishing good routines and daily habits that support optimum work, we mitigate the need to depend on “motivation” as a tool for getting things done.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>Consequences</strong></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">When we obsess over time management, we induce more stress by manufacturing unnecessary pressure that results from our addiction to productivity.&nbsp; When we make health top priority, we become more productive.&nbsp; We have more clarity and more energy which encourages productivity.&nbsp; The <strong>“consequences”</strong> for being preoccupied with managing time can result in elevated blood pressure, emotional fatigue, stress, feeling depressed and even alcoholism.&nbsp; Time is in limited supply.&nbsp; Use it wisely and we create time for things that need to get done.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong><em style="font-style: italic;">“The common person is not concerned about the passage of time; the person of talent is driven by it.”</em></strong></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong><em style="font-style: italic;">Arthur Schopenhauer</em></strong></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><figure><a href="https://weatherology.com/apps/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><img data-media-urn data-li-src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQE_7u4ccc2rKw/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1694526242268?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=KeAtWMxB2sQOy-_YF6t9ClF1Y7lPBzMsfxBrPL6q4r0" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQE_7u4ccc2rKw/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1694526242268?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=KeAtWMxB2sQOy-_YF6t9ClF1Y7lPBzMsfxBrPL6q4r0" width="480" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; margin-top: 1em; display: block; max-width: 100%;"></a><figcaption style="margin-top: 0.8em; text-align: center; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.5; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);"></figcaption></figure><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>Shift</strong></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">By focusing on using time as a tool for better health, productivity automatically increases.&nbsp; Creativity, attitude, energy, and focus increase when we make health top priority.&nbsp; By making a <strong>“shift”</strong> in how we perceive time, we gravitate toward healthy choices that emphasize making time for things that elevate productivity instead of making room in our schedule to get more done.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>Love</strong></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Many people are workaholics that labor incessantly to achieve success.&nbsp; They become addicted to work, much like people become addicted to gambling.&nbsp; It\'s behavioral.&nbsp; When work starts to become an obsession at the expense of better health and satisfying relationships, our relationship with time has become dysfunctional.&nbsp; It’s a slippery slope because work alcoholics receive praise, recognition, bonuses and promotions which fuel their appetite.&nbsp; The problem, it also leads to burn out and emotional pain.&nbsp; Learn to <strong>“love”</strong> our work and we will never work another day in our life.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>Unplug</strong></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Technology is a trap that creates the illusion of missing out and being disconnected.&nbsp; With notifications constantly “chiming” and new social apps being released that demand participation, it’s easy to get the impression an opportunity is being lost if we don’t participate.&nbsp; I don’t use Twitter, Snap Chap and plenty of other social apps.&nbsp; Guess what, my business isn’t adversely affected.&nbsp; Sometimes <strong>“unplugging”</strong> is the best way to create more time for what matters most by eliminating unnecessary distractions that consume precious time.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>Sum it up.</strong></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><em style="font-style: italic;">Any suggestions you would like to share about using time wisely?&nbsp; Share your thoughts in the comments section and please like and share this article. I love learning from you as well.</em></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>About Steve:</strong></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Steve Wohlenhaus is CEO of Weatherology, the leading company in the world at disseminating audio weather information.&nbsp;&nbsp; Steve began his career as a major market television weather anchor in Minneapolis, where he received several Emmy Awards for science programming.&nbsp; Steve is an author and host of the podcast program Anatomy of Success.&nbsp; Reach out and connect with me on LinkedIn.&nbsp; Learn more about my work and grab the free Weatherology mobile app by clicking any picture in this article!</p> </td> </tr> <tr> <td class="pt-2 no-underline" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%;
