style="display: none; max-height: 0px; overflow: hidden; mso-hide:all;">One week only. \u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;\u200c&nbsp;</div><table class="nl-container" width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" role="presentation" style="mso-table-lspace:0;mso-table-rspace:0;background-color:#fff"><tbody><tr><td><table class="row row-1" align="center" width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" role="presentation" style="mso-table-lspace:0;mso-table-rspace:0"><tbody><tr><td><table class="row-content stack" align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" role="presentation" style="mso-table-lspace:0;mso-table-rspace:0;color:#343446;width:500px;margin:0 auto" width="500"><tbody><tr><td class="column column-1" width="100%" style="mso-table-lspace:0;mso-table-rspace:0;font-weight:400;text-align:left;padding-top:5px;vertical-align:top;border-top:0;border-right:0;border-bottom:0;border-left:0"><table class="image_block block-1" width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" role="presentation" style="mso-table-lspace:0;mso-table-rspace:0"><tbody><tr><td class="pad" style="width:100%;padding-right:0;padding-left:0"><div class="alignment" align="center" style="line-height:10px"><a href="https://e.customeriomail." target="_blank" style="outline:none" tabindex="-1"><img src="https://userimg-bee.customeriomail.com/images/client-env-102368/pianote.png" style="display:block;height:auto;border:0;max-width:175px;width:100%" width="175" alt=" " title=" "/></a></div></td></tr></tbody></table></td></tr></tbody></table></td></tr></tbody></table><table class="row row-2" align="center" width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" role="presentation" style="mso-table-lspace:0;mso-table-rspace:0"><tbody><tr><td><table class="row-content stack" align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" role="presentation" style="mso-table-lspace:0;mso-table-rspace:0;color:#343446;width:500px;margin:0 auto" width="500"><tbody><tr><td class="column column-1" width="100%" style="mso-table-lspace:0;mso-table-rspace:0;font-weight:400;text-align:left;padding-bottom:5px;vertical-align:top;border-top:0;border-right:0;border-bottom:0;border-left:0"><table class="divider_block block-1" width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="10" cellspacing="0" role="presentation" style="mso-table-lspace:0;mso-table-rspace:0"><tbody><tr><td class="pad"><div class="alignment" align="center"><table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" role="presentation" width="100%" style="mso-table-lspace:0;mso-table-rspace:0"><tbody><tr><td class="divider_inner" style="font-size:1px;line-height:1px;border-top:1px solid #bbb"><span>\u200a</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div></td></tr></tbody></table><table class="text_block block-2" width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="10" cellspacing="0" role="presentation" style="mso-table-lspace:0;mso-table-rspace:0;word-break:break-word"><tbody><tr><td class="pad"><div style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif"><div class="" style="font-size:14px;font-family:Arial,&#39;Helvetica Neue&#39;,Helvetica,sans-serif;mso-line-height-alt:21px;color:#555;line-height:1.5"><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">Everything you want to do on the piano comes down to technique.</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">And having good technique is like laying a strong foundation for a house. Without it -- you can only build so high.</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">Here are 5 reasons why technique is essential to your progress.</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px" aria-level="1"><strong>1. Avoid bad habits and injury</strong></p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">\nIf you don’t have good technique, you can hurt yourself. From straining your wrists to putting too much pressure on your fingers. Teaching yourself good hand posture is hard. But with the right technique, you can play pain-free!</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px" aria-level="1"><strong>2. Play faster</strong></p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">\nPlaying fast is FUN. But getting your hands to move across the keys with speed takes practice, time, and technique. If you don’t have good technique, you’ll hit a speed wall early on.</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px" aria-level="1"><strong>3. Sound better</strong></p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">\nIt’s not just the notes you play, but “how” you play them. Good technique and finger strength will help you control dynamics (how loud or soft you play) and add emotion to your playing. It’s the biggest difference between beginner and intermediate piano players.</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px" aria-level="1"><strong>4. Get your hands to listen</strong></p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">\nIt’s a shock when you try to play with both hands and they just refuse to listen 😂. Good piano playing requires you to use both hands and have those hands play different parts at the same time. Good technique will get you comfortable doing this so you won’t have to think about it, you’ll just do it.</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px" aria-level="1"><strong>5. Learn faster</strong></p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">With good technique, you’ll be able to learn new songs in no time. That’s because you’ll already know the scale the song uses and how to play the notes and all the chords in that scale. You don’t have to start from scratch every time you learn a new song.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">Technique is so important.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">That’s why we’ve created the ultimate course on piano technique. It’s called <strong>Piano Technique Made Easy. </strong>In this course, you’ll learn EVERY major and minor scale and all the chords that are in those scales. Plus you’ll learn how to play them beautifully to build your speed and expression.</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">This course normally costs $120.</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">But because it’s National Piano Month, we’ve slashed the price for this week only.</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px"><strong>You can get it right now for just $27. That’s 78% off.</strong></p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">\n<strong>&gt; </strong><a href="https://e.customeriomail." style="text-decoration: underline; color: #0000ee;"><strong>www.pianote.com/shop/piano-technique-made-easy</strong></a><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">Technique is essential to become the piano player you want to be. And Piano Technique Made Easy is your path to playing better.</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">Grab it today.</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">Happy practicing,</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">- Lisa</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">&nbsp;</p><p style="margin:0;mso-line-height-alt:21px">\n<strong>P.S. </strong>This course is yours for life. You’ll pay just $27 and keep it forever. There are no subscriptions or recurring payments.</p></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table><table class="button_block block-3" width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="10" cellspacing="0" -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/newsletters/6916827065082134528?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BlmKC7o79TAC%2FSD08ZhJ2wg%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=0ilUnkC4b5eGY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_entity_lockup-0-newsletter_entity_cta&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_entity_lockup-0-newsletter_entity_cta-null-cmaw3x~lmz5vz2w~im-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-lmz5vz2w-im&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmUxYjI4Y2M5ZDE0NDljYWM4YjYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZmI4NGRkOGNkZTgwNmZlZjM5ZTBlMDAwNzUwYjdlMWFhMjRmMDcxZjkwOWM1YTMwNCwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" class="no-underline" style="color: #0a66c2; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-top: 16px; padding-bottom: 16px;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/week-marketing-stars-shining-b2b-linkedin-ads-lt5oc?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BlmKC7o79TAC%2FSD08ZhJ2wg%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=0ilUnkC4b5eGY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_-null-cmaw3x~lmz5vz2w~im-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-lmz5vz2w-im&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmUxYjI4Y2M5ZDE0NDljYWM4YjYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZmI4NGRkOGNkZTgwNmZlZjM5ZTBlMDAwNzUwYjdlMWFhMjRmMDcxZjkwOWM1YTMwNCwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" class="no-underline font-medium text-sm m-0 text-system-gray-90" style="cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; margin: 0px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 500; color: #282828; text-decoration-line: none;"> <h2 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500;"> This Week in Marketing: Stars Shining in B2B </h2> </a> </td> </tr> <tr data-test-id="newsletter-content-preview--content"> <td class="pt-0.5 series-article-body" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; padding-top: 4px;"> <p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">The season for B2B marketing events and awards is upon us! In the coming week, content enthusiasts will converge in Washington D.C. for the 13th annual <a href="https://www.contentmarketingworld.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Content Marketing World</a>, featuring stars from the worlds of B2B, B2C, and even <a href="https://www.contentmarketingworld.com/elizabeth-banks-headline-content-marketing-world-2023/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Hollywood</a>!</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Soon after, Boston will host the beloved <a href="https://mpb2b.marketingprofs.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">B2B Forum from MarketingProfs</a>, taking place from October 4th through 6th with plenty of heavy-hitters taking the stage. I’m also looking forward to <a href="https://advertisingweek.com/event/awnewyork-2023/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Advertising Week New York</a> (Oct 16-19) and <a href="https://www.thedrum.com/awards/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">The Drum Awards Festival</a> (Nov 26-Dec 7) in the coming months.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Celebrating the best and brightest is among the greatest joys in a field as creative and competitive as B2B marketing. LinkedIn Marketing Solutions was honored to be recognized among these leaders, earning Brand of the Year in <a href="https://www.adweek.com/performance-marketing/these-b2b-innovation-award-winners-are-breathing-new-life-into-b2b-marketing/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Adweek’s inaugural B2B Innovation Awards</a>. 🎉</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Exemplary work and talent are all around us, and will be under the spotlight during these next few months. Speaking of which, if you’d like to go behind the scenes and unpack some award-winning creative work in B2B marketing, now is your chance.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Our <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/events/7099922493724917760/about/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">inside look at winning B2B Cannes Lions campaigns</a> is happening TOMORROW – Tuesday, September 26th – at 11 AM PT/2 PM ET. The LinkedIn Collective Live broadcast will feature judges and marketers behind the campaigns dissecting what made them shine. Register now on the event page to make sure you don’t miss out!</p><figure><img data-media-urn data-li-src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQHy2ec6vbyaPQ/article-inline_image-shrink_1000_1488/0/1695661852452?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=S0czh7CH0X10GZDjMckRtUhOawbQxv4Rc_882FMqK3g" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQHy2ec6vbyaPQ/article-inline_image-shrink_1000_1488/0/1695661852452?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=S0czh7CH0X10GZDjMckRtUhOawbQxv4Rc_882FMqK3g" width="480" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; margin-top: 1em; display: block; max-width: 100%;"><figcaption style="margin-top: 0.8em; text-align: center; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.5; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);"></figcaption></figure><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Onward to the week’s must-see content for B2B marketers:</p><h3 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.17em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">What to Read</h3><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/forrester/2023/09/13/b2b-brand-investments-are-increasing-but-maybe-not-where-you-think/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><strong>B2B Brand Investments Are Increasing But Maybe Not Where You Think</strong></a><strong> (Forbes): “</strong>Website/digital” and “creative services and content” continue to lead the way in projected investment increases, according to Forrester’s Principal Analyst, <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/karenptran/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Karen Tran</a>, and VP, Principal Analyst, <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/ianbruce/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Ian Bruce</a>.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://www.marketingprofs.com/articles/2023/50009/b2b-marketing-investment-mindset" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><strong>It\'s Time to Start Thinking of B2B Marketing as an Investment</strong></a><strong> (MarketingProfs): </strong>Touching on a narrative that <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/why-cmos-cfos-should-start-thinking-marketing-like-ross-simmonds/?trk=lms-blog-b2b&amp;src=bl-po" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">we strongly believe in</a>, <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/bsjut/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Bjoern Sjut</a> underscores the value of approaching B2B marketing as an investment rather than a cost center.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://martech.org/why-tight-budgets-mean-maximizing-content/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><strong>Why Tight Budgets Mean Maximizing Content</strong></a><strong> (Martech): </strong>Companies are understandably forced to make tough decisions when business is slow, but cutting back on content production is a mistake, writes <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/michaelbrenner/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Michael Brenner</a>.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/business/marketing/blog/research-and-insights/b2b-leaderboard-top-global-brands?trk=lms-blog-b2b&amp;src=bl-po" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><strong>Introducing LinkedIn’s B2B Leaderboard: Top Global Brands</strong></a><strong> (LinkedIn Ads Blog): </strong>In case you missed it last week, we launched our brand new B2B Leaderboard informed by the B2B Index, a unique metric based on factors such as creativity, distribution and investment. Get the scoop from our VP of Integrated Marketing <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/nikitashetty/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Nikita Shetty</a> here.</p><h3 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.17em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">What to Watch</h3><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://www.skyword.com/contentstandard/building-a-marketing-machine-for-b2b-growth-with-endavas-scott-harkey/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><strong>Building a Marketing Machine for B2B Growth with Endava’s Scott Harkey</strong></a></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">In this episode of Content Disrupted, Skyword’s <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/danbaptiste/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Dan Baptiste</a> is joined by <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/scottleeharkey/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Scott Harkey</a>, who helped oversee massive revenue growth at Levvel. When the company was acquired by Endava, Harkey was tasked with replicating and scaling his operation globally. You can <a href="https://www.skyword.com/contentstandard/building-a-marketing-machine-for-b2b-growth-with-endavas-scott-harkey/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">watch the show and find highlights here</a>.&nbsp;</p><h3 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.17em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">What to Know</h3><blockquote style="margin-top: 1.5em; margin-bottom: 1.5em; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; display: block; border-width: 0; border-left-width: 4px; border-style: solid; border-left-color: #424242; padding-top: 0px; padding-bottom: 0px; padding-right: 0px; padding-left: 1.5em; font-size: 1em; font-style: italic; line-height: 1.5; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><em style="font-style: italic;">“Ultimately, you want to make sure that as a marketing leader, you’re [telling] marketers that</em><strong><em style="font-style: italic;"> we, the humans, are responsible or accountable for all these decisions and actions</em></strong><em style="font-style: italic;">, even though we use AI to assist us.”</em></p></blockquote><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/lisaberkleygately/" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Lisa Gately</a>, Principal Analyst at Forrester, shares key tips on navigating the rapid rise of generative AI in B2B marketing, in a new episode of the “What It Means” podcast. <a href="https://www.forrester.com/what-it-means/ep335-generative-ai-b2b-marketing/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">You can listen here</a>.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><em style="font-style: italic;">Make sure to follow the </em><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/linkedin-collective/?trk=lms-blog-b2b&amp;src=bl-po" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><em style="font-style: italic;">LinkedIn Collective</em></a><em style="font-style: italic;"> for more insights.</em></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"></p> </td> </tr> <tr> <td class="pt-2 no-underline" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;" data-hs-cos-general-type="widget" data-hs-cos-type="module"><div id="hs_cos_wrapper_module-3-0-1_" class="hs_cos_wrapper hs_cos_wrapper_widget hs_cos_wrapper_type_rich_text" style="color: inherit; font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;" data-hs-cos-general-type="widget" data-hs-cos-type="rich_text"><p style="mso-line-height-rule:exactly; font-size:15px; line-height:175%"><span style="color: #3b3b3b; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;">Dear Samuel,</span></p>\n<p data-key="123" style="mso-line-height-rule:exactly; line-height:175%">&nbsp;</p>\n<p data-key="127" style="mso-line-height-rule:exactly; line-height:175%"><span style="color: #3b3b3b;">In case you missed it, join in this Thursday 9/28 on our panel of experts with Andrew Ng, Robert Monarch, Juan Lavista Ferres, and Iva Gumnishka to learn more about how AI is impacting the world in a positive way.</span></p>\n<p data-key="127" style="mso-line-height-rule:exactly; line-height:175%"><br><span style="color: #3b3b3b;">AI is one of our most powerful tools when it comes to addressing the biggest challenges we face in the areas of climate change, public health, and disaster management. </span><span style="color: #3b3b3b;">AI has already been deployed as a key component of many real-world applications that are having a positive impact on things like :</span></p>\n<ul style="mso-line-height-rule:exactly; line-height:175%">\n<li data-key="127" style="mso-line-height-rule:exactly"><span style="color: #3b3b3b;">Making renewable energy sources a more viable alternative to fossil fuels</span></li>\n<li data-key="127" style="mso-line-height-rule:exactly"><span style="color: #3b3b3b;">Providing access to reliable information in more of the world’s languages</span></li>\n<li data-key="127" style="mso-line-height-rule:exactly"><span style="color: #3b3b3b;">Allowing for more effective planning, logistics, and resource allocation in the event of a disaster.&nbsp;</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p data-key="127" style="mso-line-height-rule:exactly; line-height:175%"><span style="color: #3b3b3b;">This event is inspired by DeepLearning.AI’s specialization, <a href="https://info.deeplearning.ai/e3t/Ctc/LX+113/cJhC404/VWczw54dj2NBW25G_2w13krbBVQq14553TTxPN70Sktd3qgyTW7lCdLW6lZ3nBW2YdlkX85ZgSQN8pwZcKsPB_FW8FPXDY7PJpKsW7lSnQX1SYY31W2Dp-bR5yS0GQMsSTyx_6cmFW30h08t1lB2WZW3fPV_D2xMMrmMfz_7cLH752W7_Rpnc6glymSW5cY1RH9jdYYQN2wC7vY35_q7W2ZX_Y34dtyvTW1_JjdN2tVykNW5BwCvF6QMWggW684Nn26RZfNxW2y1xC75v3VPcW5YNfbQ1vp0SrW4R0njG7Zfh7cW7Vx3pF1Xgt1bV9RT9v2fj5h-W4Vv6rw4pBp3DV4hx3v5ktVYxVd6Hhr5zW6WNf1R3B2j04" rel="noopener" style="mso-line-height-rule:exactly; color:#1c74eb" data-hs-link-id="0" target="_blank">AI For Good</a>, created in collaboration with Microsoft’s AI For Good Lab and instructor Robert Monarch.</span></p>\n<p data-key="142" data-slate-fragment="" style="mso-line-height-rule:exactly; line-height:175%">&nbsp;</p>\n<p style="mso-line-height-rule:exactly; line-height:175%"><span style="color: #3b3b3b;">Can\'t attend live? Don\'t worry. For anyone registered, we will be sending out the recorded session afterward.</span></p>\n<div style="mso-line-height-rule:exactly; line-height:175%">\n<div style="mso-line-height-rule:exactly; line-height:175%">\n<p style="mso-line-height-rule:exactly; font-size:17px; line-height:175%"><span style="font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #3b3b3b;">&nbsp;</span></p>\n<p style="mso-line-height-rule:exactly; text-align:center; font-size:17px; line-height:175%" align="center"><span style="color: #3b3b3b; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;"><strong>Don\'t miss out! Tune in at 9:30 AM PST on Thursday, September 28<br><br></strong></span></p>\n</div>\n</div></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table>\n</div>\n<!--[if gte mso 9]></table><![endif]-->\n<!--[if (mso)|(IE)]></td><![endif]-->\n    <!--[if (mso)|(IE)]></tr></table><![endif]-->\n    </div>\n   \n  </div>\n  <div id="section-4" class="hse-section" style="padding-left:10px; Billion Dollar Company &amp; Why Stuttering Made Him A Better Leader </h2> </a> </td> </tr> <tr data-test-id="newsletter-content-preview--content"> <td class="pt-0.5 series-article-body" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; padding-top: 4px;"> <p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">David Rogier is the founder and CEO of Masterclass, a platform allowing anyone access to tutorials by nation-wide experts, like Gordon Ramsey, Serena Wiliams, and more! David teaches us how great leadership is directly supported by vulnerability and empathy in the workplace. </p><figure><a href="https://greatleadership.substack.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><img data-media-urn data-li-src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQHG5vZ-NIijuQ/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1695132465580?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=QLVowcTztWLqHe5rA6PQwGLYHpPfp3ewjlscOsDoQ8g" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5612AQHG5vZ-NIijuQ/article-inline_image-shrink_1500_2232/0/1695132465580?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=QLVowcTztWLqHe5rA6PQwGLYHpPfp3ewjlscOsDoQ8g" width="480" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; margin-top: 1em; display: block; max-width: 100%;"></a><figcaption style="margin-top: 0.8em; text-align: center; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.5; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);"></figcaption></figure><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><strong>This is a free post, if you aren’t a paid subscriber yet, </strong><a href="https://greatleadership.substack.com/subscribe" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><strong>consider joining</strong></a><strong> the many others who are stepping up their leadership game with exclusive weekly leadership hacks, CEO interviews, and in-depth insights written by yours truly. If you are already a subscriber, you are awesome!</strong></p><hr><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">In this episode, I spoke with David Rogier, founder and CEO of MasterClass. MasterClass offers online classes taught by experts across various fields like business, politics, science, sports and more. With some classes on Masterclass gathering over 22 million views by people with like-minds circling the globe! </p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">While discussing the origins of MasterClass - David credited his inspiration to his grandmother\'s story of persevering to become a doctor despite obstacles as a Jewish woman refugee in NYC. </p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">He wanted to make it possible for anyone to learn from the best.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Substack</a> and read the rest of David\'s story to reveal what he does each day to ensure success for himself and his team... all while continuing to start each day with the worlds top leaders, thinkers, and authors! </p><hr><p style="margin: 0; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 600px; overflow: visible; display: block; margin: 0;\'>\n        <table class="main" width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style=\'font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; line-height: 1.5;\'>\n            <td class="main-content" style="font-family: \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Helvetica\', \'Arial\', sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; line-height: 1.5; vertical-align: top; color: #222222; padding: 25px;" valign="top">\n              <p dir="ltr" style=\'line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; font-weight: normal;\'><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">Hi Samuel,</span></p>\n\n<p dir="ltr" style=\'line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; font-weight: normal;\'><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">Discover the cutting-edge world of&nbsp;</span><a data-utm-override="true" href="https://t.dripemail2.com/c/eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..5yKub2oDlGKwvzQD-3s2R-yQ-xf9sm62kHdrsm5JQPM" style=\'font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; line-height: 1.5; color: #4477bd; text-decoration: underline;\'><span style="color: rgb(17, 85, 204); text-decoration: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 700 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">YouTube Video Recommendation Systems</span></a><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;and see how it can revolutionize your projects!</span></p>\n\n<p dir="ltr" style=\'line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; font-weight: normal;\'><a data-utm-override="true" href="https://t.dripemail2.com/c/eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..VCdq3Ia_C_8XSrFDvwznrzJ0rWFxSOAAuaUJpBsPzrA" style=\'font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; line-height: 1.5; color: #4477bd; text-decoration: underline;\'><img alt="Image" src="https://www.dripuploads.com/uploads/image_upload/image/3308474/embeddable_349a6841-993c-40ef-8b43-582947e9b0ab.png" style=\'font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; line-height: 1.5; max-width: 100%; margin-bottom: 14px; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; margin-top: 14px;\'></a></p>\n\n<p dir="ltr" style=\'line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; font-weight: normal;\'><span style="color: rgb(14, 16, 26); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">YouTube is the world’s largest platform to create, consume, and share video content. Their recommendations help billions of users discover personalized content from an ever-growing corpus of videos. According to Cristos Goodrow (VP of Engineering at YouTube), recommendations drive a significant amount of the overall viewership on YouTube, even more than channel subscriptions or searches.&nbsp;</span></p>\n\n<p dir="ltr" style=\'line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; font-weight: normal;\'><span style="color: rgb(14, 16, 26); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">So, how do their recommendations actually work?&nbsp;</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">In this lesson, we will cover the&nbsp;</span><span style="color: rgb(14, 16, 26); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">machine learning behind YouTube video recommendations.</span></p>\n\n<p dir="ltr" style=\'line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; font-weight: normal;\'><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 700 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">The Big Picture</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;</span></p>\n\n<p dir="ltr" style=\'line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; font-weight: normal;\'><span style="color: rgb(14, 16, 26); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">The YouTube recommendation algorithm is extremely challenging because of three main reasons:&nbsp;</span></p>\n\n<ul style=\'font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; line-height: 1.5; margin-bottom: 14px; font-weight: normal; margin-left: 20px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; padding-right: 0;\'>\n\t<li dir="ltr" style=\'line-height: 1.38; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; padding-left: 0; padding-right: 0; margin: 10pt 0 0pt;\'><span style="color: rgb(14, 16, 26); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">The scalability as the platform serves billions of users with billions of videos. Hence, highly specialized distributed learning algorithms are required to process and serve such a huge demand.</span></li>\n\t<li dir="ltr" style=\'line-height: 1.38; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; padding-left: 0; padding-right: 0; margin: 0pt 0;\'><span style="color: rgb(14, 16, 26); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">The</span><span style="color: rgb(14, 16, 26); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 700 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;</span><span style="color: rgb(14, 16, 26); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">videos are uploaded every second on the YouTube platform, and user behavior can also change frequently.&nbsp;</span></li>\n\t<li dir="ltr" style=\'line-height: 1.38; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; padding-left: 0; padding-right: 0; margin: 0pt 0;\'><span style="color: rgb(14, 16, 26); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">The challenge is the metadata associated with the content that doesn’t have a well-defined ontology. Further, the user satisfaction signals are implicit most of the time (e.g., watch time), which can also be affected due to external factors.</span></li>\n</ul>\n\n<p dir="ltr" style=\'line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; font-weight: normal;\'><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 700 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">How It Works</span></p>\n\n<p dir="ltr" style=\'line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; font-weight: normal;\'><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">YouTube leverages a two-tier recommendation system consisting of a candidate generation network and a ranking network. The candidate generation network aims to select a few thousand video candidates from the vast corpus of videos relevant to the user and the current context. These candidates are generally relevant to the user with high precision.&nbsp;</span></p>\n\n<p dir="ltr" style=\'line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; font-weight: normal;\'><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">On the other hand, the ranking network distinguishes candidates and assigns them a rank according to their relevance to the user with a high recall. This model uses a rich set of features describing the video (e.g., video thumbnail, video content, etc.) and the user\'s relationship to the video to assign the relevance score between a candidate video and the user. &nbsp;</span></p>\n\n<p dir="ltr" style=\'line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; font-weight: normal;\'><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 700 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">Our Thoughts</span></p>\n\n<p dir="ltr" style=\'line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; font-weight: normal;\'><span style="color: rgb(14, 16, 26); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">Learning about YouTube recommendations can help you understand how recommendation engines work in the real world. This tutorial provides a comprehensive overview of algorithms (e.g., candidate generation, ranking,</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;Multi-Gate Mixture of Experts</span><span style="color: rgb(14, 16, 26); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">, etc.) used in YouTube video recommendations.</span></p>\n\n<p dir="ltr" style=\'line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; font-weight: normal;\'><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 700 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">Yes, But</span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;</span></p>\n\n<p dir="ltr" style=\'line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", "Helvetica", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 14px; font-weight: normal;\'><span style="color: rgb(14, 16, 26); text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; box-sizing: border-box; font: 400 11pt/1.5 Arial, sans-serif;">This lesson is just the tip of the iceberg. There is much more to the YouTube recommendation systems. overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; line-height: 1.25; color: #56687a;"> The trends and stories our digital newsroom expects to dominate the coming days </span> </a> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> </td> </tr> <tr> <td data-test-id="newsletter-author-lockup" class="px-3 pb-2" valign="middle" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-left: 24px; padding-right: 24px; padding-bottom: 16px;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td valign="middle" align="left" class="pr-1 w-4" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; width: 32px; padding-right: 8px;" width="32"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/company/the-economist?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BuSKn%2FCVyRriNmU%2F93uC3UA%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=0UHz2GnUFJeqY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_author_lockup-0-newsletter_author_cta&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_author_lockup-0-newsletter_author_cta-null-cmaw3x~lmyu3gnd~bz-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-lmyu3gnd-bz&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmUxYjA4Y2NlZDU0OTk5YTc4ZjYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZjgwNTJjNWM4ZTM2ZjhmZTM3M2UxNGM2MWU3OGUwYjkwYWMzNjA2OTU3ZjQxZTljOCwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" style="color: #0a66c2; cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%;"> <img class="inline-block relative bg-color-entity-ghost-background w-4 h-4 align-middle" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQGDT-4-61kkkg/company-logo_100_100/0/1519894295382?e=2147483647&amp;v=beta&amp;t=tyOixjGXHpH5-wbbFiGihxKGGqo76y6zKiFm3YkcWyA" alt="Author image" style="outline: none; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; vertical-align: middle;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/company/the-economist?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BuSKn%2FCVyRriNmU%2F93uC3UA%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=0UHz2GnUFJeqY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_author_lockup-0-newsletter_author_cta&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_author_lockup-0-newsletter_author_cta-null-cmaw3x~lmyu3gnd~bz-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-lmyu3gnd-bz&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmUxYjA4Y2NlZDU0OTk5YTc4ZjYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZjgwNTJjNWM4ZTM2ZjhmZTM3M2UxNGM2MWU3OGUwYjkwYWMzNjA2OTU3ZjQxZTljOCwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" class="no-underline" style="color: #0a66c2; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; background-color: #dde7f1; padding-left: 24px; padding-right: 24px; padding-top: 16px; padding-bottom: 16px; line-height: 1.25;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/strikes-scupper-bidens-industrial-revival-the-economist?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BuSKn%2FCVyRriNmU%2F93uC3UA%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=0UHz2GnUFJeqY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_hero_banner-0-open_on_linkedin_cta&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_hero_banner-0-open_on_linkedin_cta-null-cmaw3x~lmyu3gnd~bz-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-lmyu3gnd-bz&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmUxYjA4Y2NlZDU0OTk5YTc4ZjYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZjgwNTJjNWM4ZTM2ZjhmZTM3M2UxNGM2MWU3OGUwYjkwYWMzNjA2OTU3ZjQxZTljOCwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" class="text-color-text no-underline" style="cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.9); text-decoration-line: none;"> See what others are saying about this topic:<span class="text-color-brand font-normal text-md leading-regular" style="font-size: 16px; font-weight: 400; line-height: 1.25; color: #0a66c2;"> Open on Linkedin</span> </a> </td> </tr> <tr data-test-id="newsletter-content-preview"> <td class="px-3 pt-2" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-left: 24px; padding-right: 24px; padding-top: 16px;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td class="overflow-hidden " style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; overflow: hidden;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/strikes-scupper-bidens-industrial-revival-the-economist?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BuSKn%2FCVyRriNmU%2F93uC3UA%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=0UHz2GnUFJeqY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-headline_&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-headline_-null-cmaw3x~lmyu3gnd~bz-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-lmyu3gnd-bz&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmUxYjA4Y2NlZDU0OTk5YTc4ZjYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZjgwNTJjNWM4ZTM2ZjhmZTM3M2UxNGM2MWU3OGUwYjkwYWMzNjA2OTU3ZjQxZTljOCwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" style="color: #0a66c2; cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%;"> <img class="block w-full" alt="Newsletter cover image" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E12AQFKfeoi1NePqQ/article-cover_image-shrink_600_2000/0/1695635203813?e=2147483647&amp;v=beta&amp;t=Bt3NTY_AwqQP11yW-Bb3PrQHgK5zjzTCVpJuCk1RGQ8" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; display: block; width: 100%;"> </a> </td> </tr> <tr> <td class="py-2" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; padding-top: 16px; padding-bottom: 16px;"> <table role="presentation" valign="top" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <tbody> <tr> <td style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt;"> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/strikes-scupper-bidens-industrial-revival-the-economist?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BuSKn%2FCVyRriNmU%2F93uC3UA%3D%3D&amp;midToken=AQEj-Z8hlKDguQ&amp;midSig=0UHz2GnUFJeqY1&amp;trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_&amp;trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview-0-title_-null-cmaw3x~lmyu3gnd~bz-null-null&amp;eid=cmaw3x-lmyu3gnd-bz&amp;otpToken=MTUwMzFkZTAxNzJkYzFjN2IzMjQwNGVjNGYxYmUxYjA4Y2NlZDU0OTk5YTc4ZjYxNzZjZTAyNmM0ZDU5NTlmYmZlZDNkZjgwNTJjNWM4ZTM2ZjhmZTM3M2UxNGM2MWU3OGUwYjkwYWMzNjA2OTU3ZjQxZTljOCwxLDE%3D" target="_blank" class="no-underline font-medium text-sm m-0 text-system-gray-90" style="cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; margin: 0px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 500; color: #282828; text-decoration-line: none;"> <h2 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500;"> Will strikes scupper Biden’s industrial revival? </h2> </a> </td> </tr> <tr data-test-id="newsletter-content-preview--content"> <td class="pt-0.5 series-article-body" style="-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; padding-top: 4px;"> <p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Hello from London,</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Motown is back! Tomorrow Joe Biden will visit a picket line in Michigan to join auto workers participating in the <a href="https://www.economist.com/business/2023/09/20/americas-big-car-firms-face-lengthy-strikes?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">escalating UAW strike</a>. One day later Donald Trump, his probable opponent in next year’s presidential election, will conduct his own pilgrimage to Detroit—just as the <a href="https://www.economist.com/leaders/2023/05/25/donald-trump-is-very-likely-to-be-the-republican-nominee?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">also-rans</a> who pass as his rivals for the Republican nomination trade barbs in California.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Politics has much to do with this <a href="https://www.economist.com/united-states/2023/09/13/joe-bidens-love-of-unions-runs-into-a-giant-strike?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">lovebombing of unions</a>: the share of manufacturing workers in America’s labour force may have been shrinking for decades, but in some swing states their vote will be crucial next November. Still, as <a href="https://www.economist.com/business/2023/09/24/does-the-car-workers-strike-threaten-americas-industrial-boom?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">our Schumpeter columnist notes</a> in a new piece written after what sounds like a fun road trip through parts of America’s “auto alley”, the United States is experiencing an extraordinary industrial renaissance. Some of it is in places you might not expect, but much of it is revitalising once written-off spots like Detroit.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Other domestic matters will command Americans’ attention this week, as—and I write these words with the weariest of hands—the prospect of a <a href="https://www.economist.com/united-states/2023/09/21/americas-dumbest-wildest-budget-fight-yet?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">government shutdown</a> once again looms. But division on Capitol Hill also threatens Mr Biden’s foreign policy. His bid to convince Congress to approve a $24bn tranche of military aid to <a href="https://www.economist.com/leaders/2023/09/21/ukraine-faces-a-long-war-a-change-of-course-is-needed?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Ukraine</a> is rubbing up against an <a href="https://www.economist.com/graphic-detail/2023/09/20/republicans-are-turning-against-ukraine?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">increasingly sceptical</a> Republican House caucus.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Meanwhile, Mr Biden’s administration is conducting a quieter effort to forge an epoch-making deal between Israel and Saudi Arabia, two historical antagonists nonetheless inching towards normalising relations. The prizes on offer are clear, <a href="https://www.economist.com/middle-east-and-africa/2023/09/24/an-israeli-saudi-pact-could-upend-the-middle-east?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">writes our Israel correspondent</a>: Israel would earn the friendship of another former Gulf foe, Mr Biden would enter an election year boasting of having re-engineered the politics of the Middle East (and perhaps lowered oil prices), and the Saudis—they hope—would obtain a formal defence pact with their American ally. Quite the turnaround for the country once dismissed by Mr Biden as a “pariah”. (Just don’t ask the Palestinians.)</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Beyond America’s domestic and diplomatic travails, this week we will be watching Spain, where the conservative People’s Party will try (and probably fail) to form a government on Wednesday; more fallout from Canada’s <a href="https://www.economist.com/asia/2023/09/19/a-devastating-accusation-by-justin-trudeau-against-india?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">devastating accusation</a> of an Indian state-sponsored murder near Vancouver; and the run-up to a complicated election this Saturday in the small country of Slovakia—which may be about to eject a government disposed towards Ukraine in favour of a Kremlin-friendly one led by Robert Fico, a pound-shop Viktor Orban whose previous bout in charge ended in <a href="https://www.economist.com/europe/2018/05/25/a-struggle-between-authoritarians-and-liberals-in-the-heart-of-europe?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">scandal and ignominy</a>. Already <a href="https://www.economist.com/the-economist-explains/2023/09/21/why-poland-is-halting-its-supply-of-weapons-to-ukraine?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">entangled</a> in Poland’s own vicious election campaign, Volodymyr Zelensky’s government could surely do without another central European headache.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">To your messages. Last week I asked you if central banks had the tools they needed to tackle inflation. <strong>Matt Blum</strong> and <strong>Christopher Wolfe</strong> were too kind to say so, but I think both thought this was the wrong question. Better for governments to take on rising prices, ideally through carefully targeted tax rises. <strong>Christopher Nicols</strong> also leans towards a fiscal response, although wants spending powers handed to “Keynesian central banks” themselves. Combating inflation with the blunt tool of interest rates alone is, he muses, “like having to stave off a motley army of orcs, evil spirits, pirates and feral woodsmen with a pen-knife that’s seen sharper days”. <a href="https://www.economist.com/graphic-detail/2020/03/30/policymakers-promise-whatever-it-takes-to-save-the-global-economy?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Whatever it takes</a>, Christopher.&nbsp;</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">This week I would like your views on a question increasingly gripping American voters, and many of <a href="https://www.economist.com/united-states/2022/11/10/joe-biden-should-not-seek-re-election?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">the rest of us</a>. Is Mr Biden too old to seek re-election? And if so, who should the Democrats turn to in his place? As ever, thanks for reading. Please send us your thoughts and feedback to: <a target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">economisttoday@economist.com</a>.</p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><em style="font-style: italic;">Tom Nuttall, Senior digital editor</em></p><h2 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.5em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">Recommended:</h2><figure><a href="https://www.economist.com/business/2023/09/21/why-it-is-a-bad-idea-for-managers-to-attempt-to-engineer-office-friendships?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><img data-media-urn data-li-src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E12AQE1xzG-2-SixQ/article-inline_image-shrink_1000_1488/0/1695638031892?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=WYWRTF0dm2s7Xmz7LG3WwFO5NmPKS6v_KdsQN300exA" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E12AQE1xzG-2-SixQ/article-inline_image-shrink_1000_1488/0/1695638031892?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=WYWRTF0dm2s7Xmz7LG3WwFO5NmPKS6v_KdsQN300exA" width="480" style="outline: none; font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.5; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);"></figcaption></figure><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://www.economist.com/business/2023/09/21/why-it-is-a-bad-idea-for-managers-to-attempt-to-engineer-office-friendships?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><strong>Why it is a bad idea for managers to attempt to engineer office friendships</strong></a></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Scholars of happiness have found that close relationships are one of the critical ingredients of a contented life. What is true in general is also true of the workplace, according to research by Gallup. The pollster finds that having a “best friend at work” is closely associated with all manner of good things, from greater employee engagement to higher retention and better safety records.</p><figure><a href="https://www.economist.com/business/2023/09/24/does-the-car-workers-strike-threaten-americas-industrial-boom?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><img data-media-urn data-li-src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E12AQHHmCIkyyCsPw/article-inline_image-shrink_1000_1488/0/1695638061262?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=_Ai7EYXVdvRFwVhH74EjuwSHvhQ8x0Z2_jakdomQK2g" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E12AQHHmCIkyyCsPw/article-inline_image-shrink_1000_1488/0/1695638061262?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=_Ai7EYXVdvRFwVhH74EjuwSHvhQ8x0Z2_jakdomQK2g" width="480" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; margin-top: 1em; display: block; max-width: 100%;"></a><figcaption style="margin-top: 0.8em; text-align: center; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.5; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);"></figcaption></figure><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://www.economist.com/business/2023/09/24/does-the-car-workers-strike-threaten-americas-industrial-boom?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><strong>Does the car-workers’ strike threaten America’s industrial boom?</strong></a></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Stanton, Tennessee, looks like a place from a bygone age. The town hall quaintly resembles a 1960s grocery store. Next door is a cannery, where townsfolk use communal stoves to make soups and peach preserve for winter. For much of its history, Stanton’s main source of income has been cotton farming, which was so depressed, many smallholders upped sticks and left. Yet amid the cotton fields something remarkable is taking shape.</p><figure><a href="https://www.economist.com/middle-east-and-africa/2023/09/24/an-israeli-saudi-pact-could-upend-the-middle-east?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><img data-media-urn data-li-src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E12AQGUsmJuxyyPfg/article-inline_image-shrink_1000_1488/0/1695638083685?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=8V3nnzQwUno8S2RUGgAF8kd9u19WG8NhMhI0uYcWB0o" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E12AQGUsmJuxyyPfg/article-inline_image-shrink_1000_1488/0/1695638083685?e=1701302400&amp;v=beta&amp;t=8V3nnzQwUno8S2RUGgAF8kd9u19WG8NhMhI0uYcWB0o" width="480" style="outline: none; text-decoration: none; -ms-interpolation-mode: bicubic; margin-top: 1em; display: block; max-width: 100%;"></a><figcaption style="margin-top: 0.8em; text-align: center; font-family: -apple-system, system-ui, BlinkMacSystemFont, \'Segoe UI\', Roboto, \'Helvetica Neue\', \'Fira Sans\', Ubuntu, Oxygen, \'Oxygen Sans\', Cantarell, \'Droid Sans\', \'Apple Color Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Emoji\', \'Segoe UI Symbol\', \'Lucida Grande\', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; line-height: 1.5; color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);"></figcaption></figure><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://www.economist.com/middle-east-and-africa/2023/09/24/an-israeli-saudi-pact-could-upend-the-middle-east?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;"><strong>An Israeli-Saudi pact could upend the Middle East</strong></a></p><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;">Muhammad bin Salman does little to hide his relish at the prospect of a strategic pact between America, Israel and Saudi Arabia. In a rare television interview on September 20th, Saudi Arabia’s crown prince and the country’s de facto ruler acknowledged with a smile that an agreement is on the cards. “Every day we get closer. It seems it’s for the first time real, serious.” A pact would, he said, be “the biggest historical deal since the Cold War.” On September 22nd Binyamin Netanyahu, Israel’s prime minister, confirmed the trio of countries were “at the cusp” of a deal. It would, he said, be a “quantum leap”.</p><h2 style="margin: 0; font-weight: 500; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-top: 1em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; font-size: 1.5em; line-height: 1.25; letter-spacing: -0.02em;">Most read by subscribers this week:</h2><ul style="margin-top: 1em; margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 1.5em; display: block; padding: 0px;"><li style="margin-left: 1em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5; letter-spacing: -0.15%; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5;"><a href="https://www.economist.com/leaders/2023/09/21/ukraine-faces-a-long-war-a-change-of-course-is-needed?utm_medium=social-media.content.np&amp;utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_campaign=editorial-social&amp;utm_content=discovery.content&amp;utm_term=li-newsletter-250923" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener" style="text-decoration: none; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; display: inline; cursor: pointer; font-weight: 600; color: #0a66c2; text-decoration-line: none;">Ukraine faces a long war. A change of course is needed</a></p></li><li style="margin-left: 1em; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5; letter-spacing: -0.15%; color: #282828;"><p style="margin: 0; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0.8em; CSS is currently the only standard in website design that plugs directly into your HTML, even the latest HTML 5 standards.
